content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
 Played this from start to finish  Unbiased Review After about more than a year since release, I decided to check this game out myself - to see whether the other reviewers might have been too harsh. Many of them played a few minutes and denounced it immediately. I have gone from start to finish. The game can safely be said to be 'complete', as in the developers won't add anything significant to better the experience. So why is this game so bad? A few facts: - 5 weapons available, where only 2 (wooden machete and M9 pistol) are actually used for most of the game- Crafting boils down to merely creating bandages, you can complete the entire game without crafting anything else- Crafting is limited to 7 items (8 in survival mode)- There are a total of 4 kinds of enemies, that pose virtually no threat whatsoever, due to inferior AI coding - The entire game can be completed in less than 4 hours- Shooting inanimate objects causes them to bleed- The single voice actor delivers his badly written lines in such way that you would quickly consider turning it off - A great deal of the game takes place in a temple area (The Maze), this area is riddled with instant death traps that are springed upon you for the obvious reason to infuriate the player and slow progress further into the temple- Level design makes frequent back-tracking unavoidable - in the maze it means constantly having to avoid the same traps over and over again- All enemies respawn after loading a save- Survival aspect in single player is negligable, due to readily available resources in all areas of the game- Your biggest threat will be the rock throwing monkeys and instant death traps- Animation quality is very low, this will be apparent from the very start of the game- No quicksave, despite the fact that frequent saving is absolutely mandatory- Most of the game mechanics rely on QTE's - bandaging takes about 20 seconds to completeA note on the added survival mode: A rather small section of the singleplayer map is isolated for you to 'survive as long as you can' - this entails running around in the day gathering food and crafting materials, then using a shelter to sleep at night. Due to the extremely barebones crafting system and the fact that everything is so easily obtainable, this experience does nothing to redeem the game whatsoever. If this kind of survival experience is desired, titles such as The Forest does this better in every aspect. So tl;dr  - if you're looking for a survival game, there are plenty of other superior titles available. This game hasn't been too harshly judged by others, it fails in every aspect of gameplay from start to finish. For the morbidly curious, this game is an exercise in self-torture - it's not conducive towards any lulz whatsoever.

number of helpful: 1,970 of 2,046 people (96%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 21, 2013
												Oh dear, poor Garry has gotten himself into quite a sticky situation! First, Garry the humble bush pilot had a bit of a mishap during a not-so routine transport job due to Yellowstone’s Mount Saint Helena erupting right as he passed over it, resulting in a crash landing in the middle of...The Amazon jungle? If that wasn’t bad enough, Garry now needs to endure countless lethal cannibalistic natives chasing after him all over the place, puzzles that’ll test your patience and game-breaking bugs that are as hilarious as they are frustrating. Let’s take a look at Garry’s Incident.So, here we have Day One: Garry’s Incident, Wild Games Studio’s brand new, first person, action-adventure survival game. You play as Garry, a pilot who just crashed into the jungle and soon realizes that, along with the aggressive and possibly very hungry natives, rock-flinging monkeys and badly animated panthers that will devour your heart without a second’s hesitation, there is also something else going on in this place. Something very strange. Something...alien.That’s basically the whole story summed up. Now that we have that out of the way, let’s look at the gameplay, shall we? So, Day One is, if anything, ambitious. It combines a lot of different gameplay mechanics in an attempt to stand out from the crowd. Though the description of the game might have you believe that this is some sort of open-world, free-roaming survival simulator like Minecraft or Don’t Starve, Day One is much more linear than that. You still have some freedom to move about the lush jungle environments as you scavenge for supplies and resources to stay alive, but this is definitely no sandbox game.Speaking of Minecraft, there are some comparisons to be made between it and Day One. In a somewhat similar fashion to Minecraft, you have a hunger meter that gradually depletes over time unless you find food via hunting, fishing or plucking fruit from bushes. Day One also has a similar crafting system, where you combine items you find and click a button to convert into new tools and other useful things. Though you can experiment with the system to craft items, you’ll also discover pieces of recipes as you explore the world. You’ll need to memorize these, because the game doesn’t log the recipe for you before you successfully craft an item on your own.The crafting itself is simplistic and the inventory menu is sub-par, making the crafting more tedious than it has to be. Click the crafting tab, then click the items you wish to use in the crafting process, hit “craft” and you might make something. Every time you craft something you need to go through the exact same quicktime event, over and over again. In fact, QTEs are very commonplace throughout the game and you’ll get annoyed by them faster than you would watching Daniel Tosh do stand-up “comedy”.Another issue with the crafting, that is also something that goes far deeper than that, is the fact that this and the hunger system are completely arbitrary. You will never really need to catch much food. In fact, you can stay alive on the random fruits you find around the world alone. This is in part due to the fact that the game only has a couple of hours’ worth of gameplay before you complete it. In other words, risking your life hunting panthers or combining dozens of random items in an attempt to make a fishing rod is absolutely pointless. You’ll never need to worry about finding water sources to drink from or refill your bottle for longer treks either. Just click C - the default “drink water at water source” button - and you can drink water directly. Anywhere. Yes, even if there is no water around.Now, the aforementioned is obviously a bug and not intentional. Bugs are something Day One has a lot of. A LOT. I’ll give the developers some credit: they’ve released about five hundred million patches by now, improving upon the abysmal performance issues players had at launch and many of the worst game-breaking bugs. But even with most of the worst bugs now fixed - hell, BECAUSE many of the bugs are now fixed - it’s just so obvious that the game sorely lacks quality gameplay.I mean, where do I even begin? Okay, let’s look past the bugs for a second. I’ve already mentioned how the crafting system is pointless. Beyond that, the game’s mandatory puzzles are incredibly tedious and often demand that you backtrack and search every single crevasse in the large environments to find that one thing that’ll let you continue.At one point, you’ll find yourself trapped inside an enormous maze of underground tunnels, where you need to pull switches in order to align some statues that opens up a gate, allowing you to escape. This simple task is arbitrarily stretched out and made incredibly frustrating by the fact that the switches are scattered around the maze far from one another, and finding them all is a pain because you only have a crude map painted on the rock walls to guide you. There are plenty of dead ends too. Sure, the various traps you’ll encounter are cool and somewhat challenging to master, but walking around for hours looking for switches gets tedious fast. This is not engaging puzzle-solving, people! It’s clearly just a cheap attempt to artificially pad out the game. In fact, the entire game suffers from this problem; you can spend a dozen hours completing this game that only has about three hours of actual gameplay and believe me, that’s not meant as a compliment here.The extensive list of mind-boggling design choices continues. The game employs a crude stealth system that allows you to sneak up on enemies and kill them in a single hit. However this system is also made pointless because you’ll find so much ammo for your two pistols that you can easily kill every enemy in the game without worrying about ever running out. What is the point of spending three minutes sneaking up on some native - or engaging in close combat with him that exposes the atrocious melee system with broken hit-registration and laughable animations - when you can just shoot him in the head and move on without risking your life? For a survival game, surviving isn’t all that hard. Well, for Garry, anyway. For you, as the player, it can be a tough test to endure the torment of this game.At least the game looks kind of okay. The graphics aren’t high-end or anything, but the jungles have a lot of foliage, making them feel lush and alive. It’s quite ambitious for such a small game. Animations, however, are not good. The world design is confusing and repetitive. You’ll also get stuck on objects or invisible walls all the time and you can clip through objects and even the ground. The sound design wobbles between mediocre and horrendous. Aiming your weapon feels sluggish. The inventory menu feels like it’s a pre-alpha placeholder. The QTEs are never-ending and...the list just goes on and on. Let’s cut it off here, shall we?I can sympathise with Garry Friedman. He’s in a pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ situation. As was I, when I played this game. No matter how hard I tried to look for redeeming factors, I just couldn’t find any. When I finally reached the abrupt ending, I was disappointed that the game just wrapped up before it ever made use of any of its interesting mechanics and before it went anywhere with the story. But, at the same time, I was also happy that I was finally out of that hell. It’s obvious that the developers had a lot of ambitious ideas, but sadly the few mechanics that work are rendered pointless by the level design and the game-breaking bugs. Despite some glints of ambition here and there, even when ignoring the bugs, there isn’t anything here to warrant purchasing Day One: Garry’s Incident.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												I don't think I have ever made a worse purchase. Keep in mind, I have bought Shaq Fu, Duke Nukem Forever, and even though I  don't like Call of Duty I still bought them to try them out. BUT THIS! This is by far the worst game I've played. I understand that it's being worked on, but more work should have been done before being put up for purchase. The combat is broken, I have no clue what I'm doing or where I'm going, the puzzles that I do find are too easy. You can take damage if you fall from a height slightly higher than your jump. Your gun...is not a gun. Guns kill people when you shoot them and the bullet hits the person. Here, it just mildly annoys them. But you! Oh you die really easily. You can take damage even if your hurting the enemy. You'll see them react to getting hit, they look like they can't attack you, but you still get hurt somehow!The game is unplayable as it is. You get attack often giving you no time to heal and figure out what to do. Some could say this adds a chalenge, but I say if that is the case then it's an unfair one. I'm just glad that it has steam cards so I can get some of my money back.Somewhere under all of the bugs, glitches and poor design choices, there is a good game. A game that can live up to the description the game gives you (the reason I bought this game thinking it might be good) but right now, unless the develepor can get some help, this game is not going to go anywhere.

												The only reason I played this game was because that it was included in a bundle.Playing this game will give you a valuable lesson on project management, as Day One seems to be a comical case of a project gone awfully bad. I want to get off Garry's ride. Don't buy this game, even for laughs, the dev doesn't deserve it.

												I played this game for 45 minutes and its honestly one of the worst experiences I've had when playing a game. I love playing "bad" video games, I find it fun but this one is just abysmal, because at least the other games I play it seemed like no effort was put in. While in Day One: Garry's Incident it actually seems like effort was put in some places but executed absolutlley horribly, I could go on about how bad this game is but instead of wasting your time, here is a list - - Crosshair during cutscenes.- No sound at all during cutscenes.- Dreadful atmosphere.- Awful music that loops.- Some of the worst sound effects I've ever heard in a game.- Really bad animations.- When you kill someone their body disappears immediatly.- The voice acting is hilariously bad.- Lots of long loading times.- And finally, when I tried to close the game it refused to.That's JUST from 45 minutes of me playing the game, imagine how bad the rest of it is, do NOT buy this game for the full price if you want to experience this game then buy it when its 90%+ off, it's not even worth it at that price to be honest.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												Short version:Prometheus, in eternal punishment, was chained to a rock where his liver was eaten daily by an eagle, only for it to be regenerated by night due to his immortality. This game feels exactly like that.Long version:PROS:-it ends, eventually, after having sucked the will to live out of you.-they never made a second episode.CONS:-buggy, very buggy...cutscenes making you stuck, teleporting you to beginning or worse, you die for getting stuck to scenery ,you die while walking, your health meter bugs out, mobs can still hit you even if the animations don't play, unfinished game menu, alt tabbing makes the floor disappear, also CTDs-graphics can look decent sometimes, but some parts have horrible models, also overall ugly textures-background sounds and some music can be acceptable, but Garry's voice, enemy grunts and animal voices are subpar and get old fast-story is almost non-existant, and what's there is either not explained or makes no sense whatsoever, also useless quest descriptions-horrible AI, horrible enemy placement (easy to get swarmed by 6 monkeys)-subpar controls, clunky, slow-ish, combat is basic and awfully animated, also I hope you enjoy having to go through a quicktime event every time you need to heal-awful instadeath traps, so many of them, paired with the awful controls it gets frustrating fast-bad level design, who knows where the levers you need are? also if you missed one, good luck going back to it passing the dozen or so instadeath traps-the survival part is useless, I only crafted bandages, that's all, you get tons of food and water anyway...and the thirst/hunger bars deplete so slowly that they're not an issue anyway-they never made a second episode, but they've managed to make another game, so yeah...there's that..Overall, stay away from this....I've only played through it as a dare, and it was awful.You deserve better than this, whoever you are.

Posted: November 26, 2013
												This game was fun at first, but overall it is pretty terrible.  There are some good puzzles but the game is horribly optimized and runs incredibly slowly on my machine while any other newer game (such as Bioshock Infinite) runs very well.  It was also full of nasty bugs, like never being able to pull a needed lever and pick up key items.  I got it on sale before it came out ($15 instead of $20) and I still feel like I overpaid/was ripped off.  The gameplay was very linear and the "survival" aspect ended up just being plain annoying/non existant.  I like to support indie games and I had some high hopes for this one, but I was sorely dissapointed...

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												This game looks good in the store but once you actually install it and play it you realise why it has so many bad reviews.For a start the graphics are awful. I mean you would think a game released in late 2013 would look good. Especially when games like Skyrim were out in 2011 for christ sake! But no! This piece of crap decided to use horrible graphics!Then theres the story. It sucks! Basically you are a guy called Gary (No♥♥♥♥♥♥) and your plane crashes leaving you in a 'Mysterious' forest and you have to survive. And thats basically it as far as story goes, except for some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t about a dead familiy. Then of course theres the actual gameplay, you know seeing as this is supposed to be a game, basically its just your average survival game. Theres a crafting system (which sucks) , it lets you make stuff like medicine and bandages. You can find food to eat and drink water. You can interact wit locals by either killing them, trying to ignore them or do the occasional quest for them. Theres also weapons you can find. At the start you get a wooded stick, which for some strange reason is incredibly effective, later on you find an old timey double barreled pistol in a temple(WTF is it in a temple for?) and even later on you get a regular pistol, aside from that i dont know as i hated this game so much that i stopped playing it after that.  The ony other weapon i encountered was a magical one shot energy cannon that is permanently strapped to your wrist. Although its meant for destroying walls it can be used as a weapon. I personally loved the idea of this weapon but what i hated about it is that it only carries one shot and you practically never get to recharge it( which is done at altar thingies).The guns you get are ridicoulsly under-powered and pretty much useless, where as your stick is very effecttive. It can kill enemies pretty quickly and if you sneak up behind people you can do a pretty cool execution-style stealth attack which is one hit kill. What i hated were the enemies that i encountered. The most common enemies are natives and i kid you not, MONKIES!!!!! The navives are easy to kill as long as you use the afforementioned stealth attack but otherwise they are really hard to beat. The monkies are actually suprisingly difficult to kill considering what they are. They basically hide and throw rocks at you and if you don't find them they will kill you quite quickly, if you do find them they just run away and start throwing stones again. This brings me to another point, the natives will sometimes just ignore you but other times will completely randomly go ape♥♥♥♥♥♥and attack you. What i found most annoying about this is that if a monkey attacks you and you attack it it will sometimes run to a native who will then come and attack you, so you have to deal with two enemies at once! Overall i personally really hated this game and would not recommend it to anyone. This game tried hard to be fun but in the end it failed and just ended up a bad far cry clone.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
Short version:Cons1. Everything.Pros1. Protagonist has a beard. I like love beards.Long version: Alright, so as you've seen from the reviews, this game is ♥♥♥♥ing terrible. I honestly bought this game because I thought I could find genuine interest for it, but I was so wrong. Even for $0.99, this game isn't worth it. This game literally is competing for bottom place with Bad Rats- it's THAT bad. Allow me to go into further detail-Music- There is little to none throughout this game. I started the game and noticed it from the get-go. There is a GIANT lack of music and it really ruins the mood for the game and ruins the playthrough for me because it's not nearly as dramatic as they wanted it to be. For instance, you'll start the game and soon after the temple you are in will start to collapse, but instead of crumbling noises from debris, it's just dead silence as you only hear you own footsteps. It's so lack luster and I think the game would be more enjoyable with more music in it. Frame rates- This game is just horrible with it. Max settings on a GTX 950 doesn't even manage to get 60 FPS when I'm outside that temple....thing....whatever it is.... It's just so horrible. Low settings still struggles to keep a steady framerate, especially when outside and combat is involved. Combat is also clunky as hell, but so are the frame rates. Heh. This game is just so unoptimized, like, it's not even funny. There have been several updates claiming to have "optimized" the game, but those patch notes are lies. These developers lied to my face by saying they optimized their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game for my sexy hardware. Bottom line, the framerates are bad/borderline unbearable even if you have a gaming computer. Animations- Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥ the animations are HORRIBLE in this game. Animations really don't flow at all, for example, at the start of the game you're introduced to our character (actually, you aren't, he's just shown sitting in his chair with no introduction whatsoever) and he appears to be pulling a "Max Payne" and has drugs, beer, pills, etc around his desk. He then proceeds to pick up his beer bottle and he (I think) starts to bring it to his mouth, but ultimately fails and tips the bottle upside down (without spilling ANY beer) and putting it to his chin. No drinking sound effects or anything, he just sets the bottle down and the game transitions into the next place- which is what I'm going to talk about next.Transitions- my literal reaction to various transitions: "Wait, what?"   "Ummmmm, how does that even work?"  They're so out of place and don't work at all with the story line. Going back to that whole "Beer bottle that he drinks from his chin" part in the introduction, the transition to the next scene is absolutely hilarious. So, he's drinking (?) his bottle from his chin and he gets some sort of transmission from his radio and it mentions something about his warehouse. Soon after, the camera zooms into the window and then severely cuts to a random shot of our protagonist in a plane to which a volcano explodes- sending him hurdling towards the ground with a blown engine. Soon after the volcano explodes and he's hurdling towards the ground, a box in the back of the plane starts to glow a blue glow and it makes a portal to which Garry (the protagonist) goes through forcefully. This begins the storyline, where he wakes up in the middle of a forest; being dragged by some tribal natives to some place. He faints and wakes up again in a temple; hearing a native with a sword sing some ritual and plans on stabbing him for some sacrifice or something. THAT'S ALL I'M GOING TO GET INTO, BECAUSE THIS STORY MAKES NO ♥♥♥♥ING SENCE AT ALL. So as you can see, the transitions make 0 (zero) sence. Conclusion- If you thought about buying this game- don't, please, save you money. Even if it's for $0.99, don't buy it. These developers don't need to be supported and get more money to make another ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game for us. Even if you're going to buy it "for the lulz" please, just please, help some starving kid in Africa instead. It's more beneficial than this cancerous game. Review is STILL accurate as of 3/25/2016

Posted: January 19, 2014
												I really enjoyed this game and it was really fun too....Are Wild Games Studios gone now?Ok, this game was a pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ It was a pile of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ kebab forged from the very depths of the sewers. This game also stamps on those who try to talk♥♥♥♥♥♥about it hence my clever review disguise, you see?I loaded up the game to be immediately greeted by a menu system that could only have been imagined by a man who'd have his testicles mounted on his wall, peering at them and polishing them at the weekends. I also noticed that this game also doesn't even have its own icon as it was still displaying the UDK icon for the game.Ok, let's crank up the graphics. This game still uses the default variable names in menus - bAllowHighTextureMaterials...REALLYI then started the game to find myself in a sacrificial chamber with the world's most oblivious temple priest of all time. I escaped from ropes that weren't even tied to anything to begin fighting him with a machete which I must of pulled out of my♥♥♥♥♥♥ I killed him and there was no death animation, he just fell over dead and vanished into thin air.I then started cutting down some lights and pushing buttons with my incredible arms that allow me to push buttons from a distance of 2 metres. Then for no explicable reason, the temple starts to crumble with broken rock meshes. I ran out of there and entered a cutscene which contained no sound at all.I followed a girl to a village and had to do a stupid fetch quest for animal meat. I went down the dirt path and saw a panther which activated possibly one of the worst QTE's I have ever come across in my entire life. I killed it and stole his meat. I brought the meat back and then stopped giving two ♥♥♥♥♥ about the missions.I continued the way I went before when I came across a pyramid. I climbed and there were many mirrors obviously placed for some kind of puzzle. I couldn't be asked and went back down the stairs again. Or atleast I would have if I hadn't died from fall damage by walking down the stairs. This showed me the death camera which would look like what I imagine a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ fly's vision to be like. It was here I couldn't stand it any longer and quit.Buy this game when it is super-cheap. I am 100% serious, you have to see this♥♥♥♥♥♥ It's so apalling this game appeared to be more of a comedy!

Posted: October 11, 2014
												I made the horific mistake of buying this game when it first came out. i started playing it and well all was well for about an hour. Then i got to the point where there was enemys and then all hell broke loose. i had great FPS but the AI were effing impossible to kill. i died hundreds of times trying to kill 1 ai. Also the game was so ♥♥♥♥ing buggy that i would glitch out when i was in any kind of building. i could be point blank with an ai and not hit them with the sword. I thought this would all be fixed because well it was a new game at the time and normally they release big patches and stuff gets fixed. INSTEAD the devs were like f*** it lets release patches that mess up the game even more. About 3 patches later my game completly stopped working  like the game would crash on launch it would crash when i hit play. it wasnt fun and then the best part was that it deleted my save file. ALL hours i spent playing this game were wasted i lost that time in my life and it wasnt even good time spent. Great games such as any of the ARMA games rock and i dont mind playing it whatso ever. now there is ONE good thing about this game. the whole story of the game (the concept of gary flying his plane into a deserted island was cool) this game was more like a massivly suckier single player version of the tv series Lost. all in all this game should be pulled off of steam and please never buy this game. you will regret it.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												EDIT: BY FAR THE WORST GAME IN HISTORY. The game is not only bad, but the Developers try to silence anyone who tries to warn others. I've submitted several discussions on the official page, only to find them removed withing seconds. (Oh also I paid £15 for this, it is now as of 27/11/2016, 0.99p that says it all.)DO NOT BUY THIS GAMEWhat in essence is a brilliant idea, with some really great features like a crafting system (even if it is exremely limited), that enables you to make some neat tools and equipment such as: a shelter to sleep in, a fishing rod, and a water pouch for when you're feeling parched. I was very interested in trying out this game the concept is great; the final product, not so much.Unfortunately it turned out to be one of the worst games I've ever played, the opening cutscene; the part that is meant to encapture the interest of the player is riddled with glitches. It begins with the protagonist blubbering like a baby to some guy who didn't know if he wanted to stand up or sit down, stand on the desk or stand IN the desk. I was willing to overlook the awful animation and unforgivable glithy-ness if the gameplay was at least half decent.But unfortunatley the gameplay turned out to be so dull that it makes smashing your face into a wall seem like entertainment. Don't be fooled by the trailer, the combat is... how can I put this... glitchy, no that's not it... terrible? Nope, that's not it either. I suppose the only real way to describe it would be "S**T!".  The game begins with the player being dragged off to some temple to be sacrificed by some locals who are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥that your helicopter crash landed into their friends, killing EVERYONE involved (other that you of course), you are then thrown into the worst combat that I've ever seen in any game, ever. Enemies seem to be able to attack you even though they clearly have a bad case of advanced rigormortism, I thought that they were zombies at first but alas, no, it's just more awful animation.My advice is to save your money and play something else. At least until the developers can admit their mistakes and put some effort into making this game playable.

number of helpful: 57 of 60 people (95%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												"Day One: Garry's disastrous fail" would be a more appropriate title for this abomination of a game. I have little to offer that probably hasn't been mentioned already, but I'd like to point out that I purchased this game for the sole purpose of experiencing the pure comedy on show, and I have to say it didn't disappoint me in that respect. So, what's on the menu with this comedy of errors then? Well, floating half-naked tribesman/woman, monkeys that appear to be on acid running aimlessly round and round in circles, cut-scenes that look 15 years old, voice acting that sounds like it was recorded by the most boring man on earth and combat so poor you'll actually laugh when you kill something. (trust me you will). One minute you're alive the next minute you're dead and often with no explantion at all as to why. Even if this game wasn't bug infested, it would still be fit only to cheer you up after a bad day at the office, because it will make you laugh at least, sadly for all the wrong reasons. So, why not buy this wonderful comedy and revel in its awfulness? On second thoughts... Don't, just don't. Good grief. 0.5/10

number of helpful: 53 of 57 people (93%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Yay, I get to review this now!Firstly, I am a huge indie games supporter, but check out 


YouTube™ Video: This video is no longer available: The Day One Garry's Incident Incident 

			Views: 5,140,236		

			On the 18th of October, the developer of Day One Garry's Incident issued a copyright strike against my channel, effectively censoring the criticism of their game.		

 as to why these devs deserve all the smacks on their collective wrists they can get. Then check out their metacritic page (http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/day-one-garrys-incident) and laugh along at its awesomeness. 0.5/10 average user score after 1548 reviews.Still, it came in the recent Bundle Stars indie game bundle, and surely can't be that bad right? Maybe just a victim of internet hate? And it has Steam trading cards, so it's pretty much me being paid to play it, right? Ha. Haha.Let's see. The graphics are absolutely awful, simple, low-rez, stock graphics pasted together, primitive character models are pretty much just going through the motions with no facial expressions and really crude, robotic animations. Corpses despawn immediately upon death, though the background corpses that are there are violently graphic.What little voice acting there is is dreadful, and really is just made up of short snippets (that often doesn't make total sense in the context - like "Uh oh" when you fail a crafting combination, even though you don't lose anything for it) set to trigger when certain events happen. It takes several hits to bludgeon enemies to death and in the meantime they don't sound very perturbed by it.The AI is deplorable, when you can shoot npcs from range and they often won't come for you as they slowly die, nor do any of their friends around them. You can even sneak right up behind an npc, shoot another one, and none of them will hear it. Even when charging right up to them, half the time they just stand there glitched and let you melee them to death.Crafting is senseless, and involves a boring little mini..game? No, not really, just a mini-animation-thing, with keys to press, that shows off exactly how poor and juvenile their animations are.The plot makes no sense, the starting video is incoherent (though the guy's utter lack of facial expression or reaction or voice as his plane is crashing is awesome), and there is no plausible explanation why things happen the way they do, like why that plasma weapon was sitting where it was or how the guy knows it's going to float up to attach to his arm or why/how he can still change weapons after that. NPCs will appear out of and walk through solid objects at will, the uneven screen shake during the starting escape portion will give you nausea, and you will find dumb bugs like how boxes during that escape portion can fall on your head and trap you inside their model without the game registering a death and forcing you to load or anything.Anyway I'm out of negative adjectives, except to say that the game is a pile of snivelporking frumpletops. This smells like a novice-level game programming class project that even for that level came out really badly, yet somehow got developed further after.Yet, you should get this game. Why? Because it makes every other game on your Steam list look better by association. In fact, maybe it belongs on my Game Collector showcase on my front profile page... hmm. But hey, don't feel too bad about it, devs, some game had to be the bottom of the barrel here at Steam. By submitting this game, you just ensured another game didn't have to be. Very charitable of you.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												The graphics resemble the first attempts of a 3D game on the PlayStation One system which allows the player to take an interesting journey back to when 3D games were challenging to see what things actually were. I love the way the hit detection is made so that when you think you are hitting it, it doesn't actually hit them, it adds so much mystery to the game! It's great the way that although it is a low resolution game, it lags like hell unless you are on a decent spec gaming computer! It prevents people that don't deserve this amazing game from playing it. I especially like the way that the game developer gave this game to me for free and told me to give it a good review and tell my friends to buy it :) So that's what I'm doing! If you are looking for a challenging game not for the actual challenge but the fact that the game handicaps the player, look no further! If you're looking for a game which is more dull than minesweeper, you've come to the right place! It is great to force your friends to play! The storyline is really unrealistic too which adds a ton to the immersion.Graphics - 10/10 (Very nostalgic of 3D games from 1998)Gameplay - 10/10 (Brilliantly challenging, may be almost impossible to play!!)Story - 10/10 (All the good parts of FarCry 3 removed to give you a nice nitty-gritty experience)Music 4/10 (It sets the tone and style of the game and has a long and various soundtrack [Not for me!!] )OVERALL A 10/10 WORST GAME EVER! MUST BUY!EDIT: So the game is now in the weeklong deals. That's fab, more people can experience the melted rainbow of a game that is Day One: Garry's Incidence. I am... happy... that Steam are behind this game and even went so far as to use it as a main game on their homepage. Steam would be making a mistake if they weren't endorsing this! Oh wait, no, the developer just bribed Steam to do it. Wow, that shows that the developer has the money and is therefore a great developer! I'm just going to go send him some money on PayPal. Oh and some advice to the dev: If you made physical copies of the game, then the game would be worth almost 20 times as much by the value of plastic in the case and ink in the instruction manual. Maybe Gamestop will sell it? Just a thought.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2015
												Rating this game a 2 out of 10 is being generous. Everything about it feels low effort, this is substandard for what a hobbyist UE3 modder might come up with. The game is tiny. You can run the entire circumference of the game world in about 3 minutes. It's populated by 4 NPC types. You have angry red diaper tribesman, angry brown bra tribeswoman, angry poo flinging monkey, and angry black cat. The bandages are bugged, if you cancel them before they finish you are healed full anyway and they are not consumed, so the survival aspect is out the window. Your supplies are virtually unlimited. The weapons make absolutely no sense. Your 9mm autoloader and your cap and ball pistol both reload by gently rubbing them. The game is plagued by technical flaws. Nothing feels right, nothing looks right. It's hard to explain, but everything is WONKY. That is the only word for the combat and movement in this game. Performance is inconsistent at best. The game doesn't even support my native resolution of 1360x768 so I played it in a window. But above all else, the sound design is horrific. I just played with the whole game client muted. The game is better muted than with sound on, trust me. You will never hear anything worse in your life as long as you live than the sound design of Garry's Incident.

To readers: Due to steam can't accept more than one review per game, I'll write any review with: English - most Steam users' main language and Chinese - my native language, language will be set to English. Hope you understand, and thank you.In a word: Good for the idea, bad for a game.一句话：创意不错，游戏太渣。I buy this game for it's concept, the weird story, the nice crafting system I think, and open world. But after my installation, I found the game totally bad optmization, and... WHAT THE [Beep]ING MARLETT FONT ON THE WALL?? I can't enter scene 2 just bacause my laptop is not so good? So, I feel sad for this game, and the developer, very sad.之前购买这个游戏是看中了其创意和特别的故事，还有开放世界和我认为极好的加工系统。但装完了才发现，这游戏实在是优化太差，然后……墙上的Marlett字体的文字是怎么回事儿？然后……我竟然因为我本子太差进不了第二个场景！？这游戏和其开发者真的太令我伤心了。Pros / 优点Weird story, maybe interesting;  /  诡异到可能很有趣的故事；Nice crafting and item using.  /  不错的加工和物品使用方式。Cons / 缺点Bad optmization;  /  优化差；Weird bugs;  /  怪异的BUG；Perfunctory Marlett font on the wall(Sorry, I just can't appect it);  / 墙上那敷衍的Marlett字体……抱歉，我受不了；No more, sorry. Because I have't play too deep, this game just prevent me for this. :(  /  抱歉没有更多了，我玩的不多，因为这游戏根本没法让我继续下去。 :(

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												This game is the jurassic park trespasser of modern gaming, It tries to bring something which hasn't been done very often and has some ambitious ideas which is why I wanted so hard to enjoy the game but it's just not fun. The crafting and survival system is about as in depth as farcry 3. The combat is terrible, guns don't sound anything like they should and melee is clumsy. Day one looks and plays like a game released 7 or 8 years ago. The story from the beginning cutscene is almost non existant, read the plot on the product page to have any idea what is going on. As for variety of enemies we have panthers, evil tribals and monkeys throwing rocks, avoiding spoilers there is on more type but nothing exciting. One problem that really needs to be adressed is tabbing back to steam and back in screws up the video in game had to restart every time. Really couldn't recommend getting this game no matter how hard i try to like it.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2014
												The story so far...    My name is Garry, and I am a wise-cracking, lecherous alcoholic.  One day, whilst out flying my light airplane, a, er...I think it was a volcanic eruption or something...causes my plane to crash in an apparently uncharted - though presumably close to home - jungle.  I wake up from unconsciousness to find myself being dragged by "savages"/cannibals/guys in fancy dress to an unknown destination.  I again fall unconscious and awaken once more to find myself tied down to a sacrificial altar, with some joker about to stab me in the heart with what I guess, given the circumstances, must qualify as a "sacrificial" knife.  Not tied down very WELL, fortunately, as I easily break my bonds, grab a weapon and enter into a brief but awkward (but swiftly victorious) "combat" with my would-be murderer.  There is a native girl nearby in chains...my character briefly ponders aloud in a Duke Nukem-esque voice whether he should save her - thereby perhaps further risking himself - or leave her to her fate.  I choose to split the difference, and murder her in cold blood with a swift slash of my knife.  Garry has no time for sentimentality, he has some serious drinking to get back to...but first, he must of course return to civilisation.      I begin to search around the huge temple area, and find two fruit-like objects on the ground...I attempt to pick them up.  Wondering why I do not seem to be having any success, I suddenly realise that they have been inside a BARREL all this time - or did the barrel just come crashing from out of the thin air above to magically envelop them?  It certainly seemed that way.  No bother.  Garry will not be hampered by any mere barrel, so he smashes it to smithereens and "obtains" the mangos.  The Gods can do their best to hide mangoes from Garry, but Garry laughs at the Gods and their petty whims...if Garry wants mangoes, so Garry shall HAVE mangoes.  And so I continue searching about the grand sacrificial hall, and find only a pair of double doors which not only refuse to open, but indeed refuse to even be acknowledged in any noticeable way, shape or form.  Just decorative, then.  So be it.  There must, however, be a way out of this wretched place, with its high ceiling and burning braziers and cleaved-in-two bodies casually scattered across the floor like so much spilled milk in a share-house full of slackers.    But what is this curious writing upon the walls?  No, not writing...cave drawings...telling me I must cut some chains on some suspended braziers in order to get two eyes to light up on an Easter Island-style stone head.  Of course!  Why had I not thought of this before!!  Foolish, stupid Garry.  Two broken chains later, another Easter Island refugee slides aside and a way out is revealed.  Garry can practically TASTE the freedom in the air!  We press on...    There is another savage up ahead, with his back fortunately turned to me.  I am informed by the on-screen gaming Gods that I can perform a sneak attack by pressing "CTRL" and edging forward, then pressing "E" when I reach my quarry.  I accomplish this, effortlessly but bloodily, by apparently placing my knife to the front of his throat and pushing inward (no "slashing" or "slitting" required).  Who are these strange men, with throats as soft as butter?  I have not the time to ponder, as I must press on as always...    A room, with three buttons with symbols on them.  There are large amounts of intricate "writing" on the walls about them.  A time-consuming puzzle, perhaps, for Garry to decipher?  No heed, I shall simply press the three buttons, left to right...SUCCESS!  No devious puzzle shall prove a hindrance to Garry.  And what is this?  A strange object has appeared on a nearby stone, near to where I have recently picked up a flintlock-style pistol.  It is a magical armband, which Garry - being no slouch, and having no need of trial nor error - is extremely quick to realise, so of course, he tries it on.  It glows with an ethereal energy!  A new weapon, it seems.  But no rest for the wicked, as the whole temple begins to crash down around Garry's feet!  But alas, I am too slow, and soon enough find myself trapped within a multitude of fallen stone blocks which, in spite of failing to kill me, have effectively trapped me to the point where I have no choice but to restart from the last save point.  Such is life.      The second time around, Garry manages to avoid being trapped or crushed by falling debris, and even manages to casually shoot a fleeing savage in the back as he, like Garry, can do little but helplessly run for dear life.  We emerge, at last, into the open air of the jungle!  Not home and hosed yet, Garry.  Indeed, it is only seconds later that, erm, SOMETHING occurs - there is some vague semblance of a scuffle, and now there seems to be a savage running away in front of us - ah!  The on-screen gaming Gods inform us that she has stolen Garry's all-important FLASK, and as Garry is quick to observe out aloud, he can get by without "the women" but he cannot survive without his regular alcohol intake.  The chase is on, then, to reclaim Garry's flask!  Fortunately, the savage leaves a highly visible trail of stardust we can follow, even when she runs out of our sight.  At some point she decides the game is up - Garry is clearly too much of a match for her - and she stops and turns, patiently awaiting the fate which must surely become all who dare come between Garry and his demon drink.  The dastardly pickpocket duly dies for her sins, without so much as a fight.  She knows what she has done is wrong.  This is what befalls all who do not embrace the moral purity of Capitalism and choose instead to run around in wildernesses wearing loincloths.  Bet she didn't even know what "AFK" means, the brutish savage.  No doubt she would be vote-kicked from a bout of Left 4 Dead 2 Versus within two flaps of a butterfly's wings.  But fear not, Garry is here now in the land of the savages, and he will cleanse them all with not only the might of his magical armband, but drive his point home with the boisterous cut, thrust and parry of a well-placed and witty one-liner.    But alas, it is here that we shall - for now, at least - end our tale of the wondrous adventures of Garry, lost in the land of the savages.  Is there more to come?  We shall have to wait and see if I could, in all honesty, be ♥♥♥♥ed.   Verdict: 4/10 (6 out of 10 for sheer amusement value; 2 out of 10 for actual game quality...averaging out to 4.  See, Garry's pretty good at math, too...)

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
												The exploding volcano and teleporting plane raised my initial interest, but it only lasted 20 minutes. I stopped playing after coming down from the 'pyramid' and getting oneshotted by one of the natives. The game definitely needs more polish.The jungle area seemed very confined, with lots of narrow paths surrounded by unpassable walls. I had flashbacks to the forest areas of Zeno Clash and the jungle area of Lands of Lore 2.The saving system is problematic - it doesn't fully record the state of the world. On game load, enemies seem to respawn (even set pieces), destructible obstacles are back, and the action sequence screen shake isn't there anymore. The loading times drained my patience since I was getting killed every minute.

number of helpful: 20 of 22 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
												My thoughts go out to anyone who, for whatever reason, bought this thing at full price. After 1 hour playing Day One: Garry's Incident, I was overcome with a feeling of shame for ever giving any other game a bad review, because the reason for those just seem petty now in comparison.The game starts with a cutscene drenched in screen tearing even though vsync was enabled. I then find myself (as Garry) strapped to a stone altar of sorts in the second cutscene after which I must perform an action (mashing a button) to free myself before an awfully animated shaman ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sacrificially stabs me. During this whole scene there is absolutely no ingame sound, not even crickets. It's like they forgot to include the sound files related to that event in the game.After freeing myself and making that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ animation meet its demise, I find this scantily clad indigenous babe chained next to the altar and I'm faced with the choice of either freeing or killing her. Being a gentleman (one who sports a blade in case things go sour anyways) I decide to let her go, but I'm using a gamepad and the controls I'm being shown onscreen keep switching randomly between keyboard and gamepad directions, so I end up having to guess what to press only to hear her whimper as I kill her accidentally. Now she's dead, oh welp. I hit her again because... because yes, and she blurts out the same cry. And again, and again, and again. Outstanding. From now on it can only get better.Now I'm wandering around the temple until I find a piece of cloth and get instructions to craft it into bandages. I do that, and then I place two bandages in the crafting window to see if I could further combine them, and that's when our Garry says it out loud: "UH-OH!" and the game just crashes, with an UDK failure pop-up on Windows and all. That was actually funny because it seemed like he had suddenly become sentient (with a touch of clairvoyance) to our out-of-game reality, and I would naturally have considered a feature like that a pro, had I not found after relaunching the game that Garry says that every time you try to combine un-craftable things. Disappointment.Voice acting is not something I'm picky about, but here it is a thing to behold. I feel however I lack the vocabulary to describe something like that, and that it would be like trying to transcribe the humour in someone else's stand-up comedy act through written word. YouTube is just around the corner if you're curious.Given the red wall of top rated negative reviews glaring at you from the front page of the game's store, where even the couple of positive reviews are either sarcastic or humorously and explicitly trying to not be flagged as 'innapropriate' by the dev (who seems to have tried to do that with no success), you'd have to be blind, stupid, masochistic or possess some real next-level avant-garde sense of irony to buy this game.But if like me you got this in a bundle (with other games that you wanted) for nearly nothing, you might feel compelled to let its trading cards drop at some point. When you do that I'd humbly suggest playing the game while you wait for the drops rather than just idling, just so you can experience first-hand what will likely be the most ludicrous attempt at a game that you've ever played. If not for science, then for the sheer comedic value. And unless you're much more easily amused than I, the comedic value will last about as long as it takes for the cards to drop, at which point it will be the right time to quit and uninstall this garbage.Not that I'm trying to tell you how to live or anything.

number of helpful: 16 of 18 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												I'd heard about this game through TV Tropes and TotalBiscuit, so when I happened to get it as part of a bundle I decided to try it out.It certainly lives up to its reputation.See, this game uses a titanic amount of memory, which... limits its framerate somewhat.  Forget advancing through the story.  Forget survival challenges.  Hell, forget looking for amusing glitches.  Simply moving from point A to point B is an aggravating ordeal.I can deal with the abrupt instant kills, the gratuitous invisible walls, the overly simplistic stealth mechanics, and even those damned monkeys, but not when the framerate feels like my screen is grinding against my eyes.The worst part is that this could have been bad in a funny way.  Like, for example, one time I tried to shoot an enemy from atop a pyramid, but not only did an invisible wall block my shot, the ricochet killed me!  I still didn't have my last trading card, so I spent the next few minutes killing myself against that invisible wall, just to pass the time.  Unfortunately, if this game is ever brought a playable state, most of the more entertaining problems will probably be fixed as well.  Too bad.Anyway, don't buy this.  If you get it in a bundle, don't install it.  This game is painful to play.  Leave it be.

number of helpful: 17 of 20 people (85%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												I don't know how I wound up with Gary's Incident in my account, but it was there when browsing through my Steam library. I fired it up, interested in seeing if it was really as bad as . . . everyone -- literally every one . . . has ever said. After all, I tend to be a contrarian. Maybe it has some redeeming qualities.After playing for a bit, I can confirm that it does not. Everything about Gary's Incident feels like a very early iteration of a high school first time 3D UDK development project. If a young person came up to me and presented this to me as their creation, I would be highly impressed. Unfortunately, when I come to Steam, I expect professional-quality projects created by actual game developers -- even if independent. What I don't expect is someone's janky first-time project. Don't pay for this. If you get it for free, don't waste the bandwidth downloading it. Don't waste your time playing it. I am worse for having wasted precious moments of my life on this thing.

number of helpful: 15 of 17 people (88%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												The artist(s?) is clearly the top member of the development team. As bad as most of the game is, at least the models for everything are high-poly enough to look pretty decent. Granted this doesn't work for any of the animals as they look as flat and devoid of any fur detail as your average PS1 game.Disregarding the now infamous events surrounding the game, expectations should be tempered considering it is an independent game title from a studio you've never heard of. Even then, it disappoints.You can do stealth kills on the amazon women... with the same death roar as the men you kill. You can kill every animal in the game with a single pistol bullet (even from the awful double barrel "old pistol") yet it takes 3 pistol rounds or 2 M9 rounds to kill a completely unarmored person. Nearly all interaction animations end up throwing the camera underground, zooming in the camera so much you can't see the animations, or having the model clip through the camera. Most crafting is trial and error as even when there are recipies oddly drawn on some rock, half the ingredients are "helpfully" displayed as scribbles. Granted all you ever need are bandages and the leather water jug anyway. Lighting is all sorts of wrong and broken... but then again it is an Unreal Engine 3 game.There was a $50k kickstarter for this game, which failed, and I think that explains the game. The kickstarter failed, so the developer probably just gave up and put the unfinished beta into Greenlight. With the absolute zero quality control there of course it got accepted. I hear all but one guy left the company some time after release, which explains the tiny insignificant update made two years after release.Also, optimization/performance is unacceptably poor. I may not have the toppest of the line rig, but an overclocked i5-3570k, GTX780 Lightning, and enough RAM to run a large server should not be struggling to keep above 30 while running Crysis 3 on Max hovers around 45-60 and keeps games with similar-yet-better graphical fidelity to this one like Dead Island and Far Cry 2 well above 100 FPS.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												I was having a fair amount of fun. It reminded me of what a survival game might be like on the ps2. The pros are there and so are the cons.+Whatever the hell you find interesting about this game (if you like survival games you might like this)Cons: Where do I start-Bandages heals you when you're dying of dehydration (you never have to drink water if you have a bunch of bandages)-The only drinkable water source I could find was the one in the friendly camp-The only real challenge I could find was "find a drinkable water source"-Gives you missions but doesn't tell you jack about how to complete them-The AI are idiots-The most dangerous thing in the game (a panther) can be killed by letting it jump on top of you and by pressing w. Instant kill, you're fine, it's deadThe reason why I can't recommend this game above all is because of a game breaking glitch that doesn't make any sense to me. When I tried drinking out of a water source my game froze for a couple seconds and I was teleported back to the temple you leave when you first start the game. All i had on me was the wooden sword you get at the beginning of the game. If something in the code caused this (if it's supposed to happen) then that's total bs and makes no sense. Thumbs down for a broken game, thumbs up for a decent concept of native jungle survival exploration,

content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												I wish I could find something redeemable to say about this game, and believe me I'm still searching for something...  The reality being this is a very buggy, very boring and ugly game, and charing $20 for it blows my mind.  I was mildly amped at first to try a FPS survival game, but it falls short in every way possible.I can overlook the clunky graphics.  I cannot however overlook the numerous invisible walls, the horrid and boring combat and at times frequent see-through-walls syndrome.  I also want to smash my keyboard every time some mundane action or task comes up and you are forced to do mind-numbing quick-key actions.  This game feels like it'd be at home on the Wii to purchase in the online store for $2.99, but do yourself a favor and definitely do not pick this up for $19.99.  Maybe wait until a massive sale and pick it up as a gag gift for someone you don't like that much on your friends list.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2014
												I played this game for a little over an hour and a half and I really wanted to like it.  I kept making excuses for the stupid mechanics and having no idea why I was taking damage or why I could bump into a guard while sneaking up on them and they had no idea I had ran into them.  After all the frustration, I decided to come back to the store page to see if there were any updates listed or any dates on when it would come out of "Early Access" alpha or beta stage it was in.  Then I realized... this wasn't an early access game.  The developers actually think this is a finished production quality piece of work.  Wow.  That is sad.Collision detection doesn't work.  Damage seems to be broken.  Weapons are unbalanced.  The special weapons you see in the movie are basically one shot items for the most part because they have to be recharged and there is no recharger point.  The blue glowing magic rocks embedded in your arm weapon?  I got it... but I have no idea how to use it and it is not in the weapons list when I scroll through.  I saved the amazon queen only to have her stand up and immediately disappear which froze my screen.  I waited about 15 seconds and then I got control back and it told me that I had cooked some meat.  Uh... I was no where near a fire.This game has flaws and its flaws seem to have flaws.  There is potential here but even if all the mechanics were fixed, I still wouldn't want to play it for the inane voice overs that this guy spews.  Its like they wanted to be funny like the original Duke Nukem games but have no idea what funny is.Do not buy this game.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding Chocolate-Caramel Cream Pie recipe you've come to the right place.IngredientsAll-purpose flour, for surfaceChocolate pie crust1/2 cup sugar1/4 cup cornstarch3/4 teaspoon salt2 1/2 cups whole milk4 ounces bittersweet chocolate (preferably 61 to 70 percent cacao), finely chopped4 large egg yolks1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract2 cups Whipped cream2 tablespoons caramel1 thick block bittersweet chocolate, room temperature, for garnishDirections1. On a lightly floured work surface, roll pate sucree to 1/8-inch thickness. Fit into a 9-inch pie dish. Trim edges, leaving a 1-inch overhang. Tuck overhang under dough so edges are flush with rim, and crimp edges. Lightly prick bottom of dough with a fork. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line dough with parchment, and fill with pie weights or dried beans. Bake until edges begin to look dry, 20 to 22 minutes. Carefully remove weights and parchment. Bake until crust is darker around edges and bottom looks dry, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack. (Chocolate crust can be stored overnight.)3. Whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a small bowl. Heat milk and chocolate in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until chocolate melts.4. Whisk 1 cup hot milk mixture into sugar mixture until smooth. Whisk milk-sugar mixture into the remaining milk mixture in the saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until bubbling and thick, 4 to 5 minutes total (about 2 minutes after it comes to a boil).5. Whisk yolks in a medium bowl until combined. Pour in milk mixture in a slow, steady stream, whisking until completely incorporated. Return mixture to saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it just begins to bubble, 1 to 2 minutes.6. Remove from heat, and stir in vanilla. Let custard cool in saucepan on a wire rack, whisking occasionally, for about 10 minutes.7. Pour custard into chocolate crust. Press plastic wrap directly on surface of custard. Refrigerate until custard filling is chilled and firm, at least 4 hours (or overnight).8. Gently fold caramel into whipped cream, then spread the caramel whipped cream over pie. Using a vegetable peeler, scrape chocolate block at a 45-degree angle to make a small mound of shavings, and sprinkle over whipped cream. Serve immediately, or refrigerate and serve within 2 hours.TipThe caramel mixture must be very cold before the whipped cream is folded in. Otherwise, the whipped cream will collapse.Hope you like the new one :) not lemon anymore

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												This game is unfinished, unpolished and though it has nice ideas it isn't worth the money in its current state!The Reviews on the Steam page were promising and it was on discount so I bought this game. It didn't say Early-Acces, it was sold as finished work. What I got is a game that feels tremendously UNFINISHED! The animations are artificial, I have seen better graphics in Far Cry(2004!). The sound is cheap and so is the voice acting. The graphics use a lot of performance and heat up the system. The menu overlay is quirky, slow and unresponsive. The combat system is dull. You can kill one of the friendly NPCs and noone notices or get hostile. Everything looks like they stopped developing half way.I'm willing to accept minor quirks when the concept is good and when it was developed thoroughly. But for the price of around 20€ the quality has to be a lot higher. And sadly they failed with this game and I feel like I wasted my money on this.

number of helpful: 23 of 38 people (61%) found this review helpful24 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												Do not buy this game. I repeat, DO NOT buy this game! It will keep you captivated for hours on end and nothing else will be important to you any more - not your friends, not your family, not work, hell, not even eating or sleeping! The story line is thrilling - I mean, an alcoholic pilot transporting magical artifacts over the Yellowstone Caldera which happens to erupt with no warning and then being teleported to an Amazonian temple? GENIUS! Give the storywriter a medal! Oh, and the bugs are just to die for! Both of my saves are bugged so badly that they are unplayable, one where I am stuck underground and the other where I fall repeatedly through the world and die on spawn - and I'm only 5 minutes in! The bugs add an additional challenge that will entertain and excite all gamers, casual and hardcore alike! Oh, and the nostalgic graphics that take you back to the early 90's? Absolutely wonderful, it's almost as if the developers knew what we were craving for!! Meanwhile, the death animations are faultless - dropping with no elegance and disappearing almost immediately off the face of the Earth. Let's be honest, nobody wants to see a corpse lying around and nor do they need an over the top, dramatic ragdoll effect when you end a poor fools miserable life. You must be thinking 'I must buy this, what more could these Gods amongst men possibly provide us?'. Well, Don't get me started on the acting! Seriously, how these guys haven't cracked Hollywood is beyond me! The same monotonous tone is used throughout, whether it is making a comment whilst slaughtering a poor, innocent captive or stubbing your toe on the floor as you pass through it to an untimely, buggy doom. This familiarity is a necessity in the gaming world, allowing you to know exactly who you are still without breaking out of the captivating immersion!Oh, and did I mention that the game also allows you time to reflect on it's own brilliance in the form of lag and over the top loading times, even with a £1000 well specced PC? Just a little extra given to us by the amazing Wild Games Studio!0/10 Would buy!

content:
Posted: February 7, 2014
NosebleedsTo many bugs in startup. To many workarounds to get the game running, not even a decent pre-setup to do some finetuning on the game. All this reminds me of games made in the 90s when most setups weren't required since everybody either owned a CGA, EGA, VGA or SVGA card. And there were only Adlib and Soundblaster cards for sound.Well, at those times you got at least a game running even IF your Ram wasn't high enough, you could do finetuning with some kind of memory manager. In this game you are first greeted by... Locked Display error, after you solved this little trouble you get to know the slow flash mode of the game, alternating between black screen and desktop - with no normal way to interrupt the game but to restart the computer. After you have solved this problem, you see a screen and video with some glitches (No, I have two computers one with integrated graphics and the other with a high end graphics adapter - it's the same with both).So recomendations? What for? For a game which might have been a good game if the programmer worked on a broader basis and didn't try to enforce their own narrow side of game design? For a game full of bugs, glitches and frustrating workarounds? Steam would do a good thing to remove their approval and remove the trading cards on this game. Supporting a narrow set of boards and configurations is always a bad thing. This game would get zero points out of ten for bad conduct. Prospects and after release debugging aren't a good way to start, especially when the prospects don't come even close to the expectations one held for a game.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												I went into this game having forgotten everything about it when it was launched. It started off promising with no sound effects until the first guy was dead. After which, he vanished. I then found a captive lady who I promptly killed, and continued to make the same horrific death sound about 10 minutes afterwards. The instructions on the walls were very subtle, so much so I spent a long time in the first area because I was captivated, I mean lost.After I had managed to get out of the first room after the huge stone structure slid across the room like it was on ice, I managed to escape the temple. I then had my flask stolen, and was promptly instructed to follow the glittery path the thief left. When they stopped, I shot her. To which I was prompted with a static version of the model...and my flask back. Kill the entire village (all of which made feral sounds when they died). One shot a panther....to die from a monkey because it was funny as running around flinging what I can only assume was poo at me. Death by poo is not fun by the way.When trying to remember what about  this game seemed so familiar, I remembered that a few youtube commentors had reviewed it and got the book thrown at them because of it. I can't understand why, because they were telling the cold hard truth. This game feels and looks like it was built by a single todler. Half the menus get this weird yellow box around it which stops the rest of it from working, the controls feel like I have my hand up Garry's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and controlling him through his rectom. The combat is poor, the "special effects" look like they came from 2001...and this was built on the Unreal 3 engine. An engine which has been used many times to produce beautiful games. I didn't even think it was possible to ♥♥♥♥ up a game this badly since that DayZ rip off.....wait a minute.In closing, this review is something you should read before buying, or playing this horrendous game. I bought this in a bundle of 6 or so other games for about $4AUD, and even then I feel ripped off. After writing this, I'm going to promptly take the hard-drive it is installed on and burn it, as there is no other way to remove that vast amount of♥♥♥♥♥♥off an electronic device.P.S. If the developer is reading this, don't censor this and remove it. I paid hard earned cents and I'm allowed to voice my opinion and facts on this game. I couldn't give a monkey's toss (hehehe) if you don't like it. I would rather save some poor kid his pocket money than have this game be sold.P.P.S I've had ♥♥♥♥♥ that have been more pleasent and larger replay value than this game..and I can't bring myself to finish this.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												I'm getting dizzy just by looking at the title of the game in my library. I'm literally in a near-puke state, at any time i can puke all over my PC, and I'm not even joking. The graphics are HORRIBLE, it caused me eye cancer several times while playing. There are lag issues. The textures are buggy as hell. What more can I say? OHHH. QTEs. The worst kind of. There are so many quick time events, that it's just irritating. For example, when healing, drinking, when getting attacked by a ♥♥♥♥ing panther every single time and so on. The crafting is okay, not too bad, not too good. The AI is messed up. Sometimes enemies charge at you from 3000 miles away, and sometimes they are just standing there, with their beautiful glowing blue eyes. Oh, not forget to mention, the sneak-system is not working, they will always find and attack you. There are 3 types of enemies if i'm correct: the natives, the ♥♥♥♥ing monkeys, the humoncoulous' (they appear on trading cards), and waaaay too many traps, which are a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥to avoid(especially the axe). It isn't survival-horror. It's only survival-horror for you, because this game is so damn broken on many-many levels. It's like the movie Ring, but in this case, playing the game will surely cause you cancer, leukemia, AIDS, and death, all at once. The story is dumb, maybe i'm stupid or something, but I just can't understand the plot. You are flying all over the place, when suddenly a big BANG, a volcano erupts, and your plane is going down becasue of a plasma hellgate, or i don't what is it. And you have that blue stuff on your plane. I don't know what it is, it's just confusing. Alright, so you landed, and you wake up in a temple with a bone sword or something like that, it's just useless. The enemies will kill you faster, and oh, the blocking is broken too. Sometimes it's effective, sometimes not. There are 3 levels if I remember correctly, and the ♥♥♥♥ing maze is the most frustrating part, when you have to move head statues. That map is filled with traps, like swinging axes, which are the hardest part to avoid, because the hitbox of the axe is too big, there are falling floors,  spears coming out of walls, and wall spike thingies. I've played this game for 3 frustraing hours, because i wanted to see the poor ending. And well, well, I was right. There was no ending at all, some alien ships came by, and just a "to be countined" screen. PLEASE DON'T MAKE THE SEQUEL. God knows how many poor souls have been devoured by this miserable game. And finally, the FREE DLC, HURRAY! FREE! It's strange that the DLC isn't at least 10-20 euros. At least they were aware of their capabilities. Alright, so, when I finished this awesome game, wanted to check out that spooky free DLC. I clicked it, and all I was seeing were that Garry was falling with his magic♥♥♥♥♥♥♥forearm-blue-plasma-gun, with that typical default model standing position, in complete grayness, and then the game crashed(for me at least, i don't have any friends who played this pile of junk). It's a shame that you can't delete games permanently from your library... 10/10

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												Do you like games that spawn you under the map and kill you over and over? Do you like horrible guns that miss at point blank range? Do you like very stupid monkeys throwing rocks at you while they face the other way, and still hit you? Do you like crappy voice acting and crappy AI? If yes,  DONT BUY THIS TRASH ANYWAYS. Im embaressed to even have played this game. What did my computer do to deserve to have to run this garbage? This game is so broken that, you could clone Bob the builder 100 times and still no be able to fix it. Its called Day One because Garry could only take on day of this crap. I had to kill a bunch of monkeys, is that what games have come to? Killing little moneys? How can i call myself a man knowing i had to do that crap? The temple with all the traps took me three diffrent playing sessions, because i could not take the awful layout and setup. When you try to craft somthing and learn you can't, big bad Garry simply says 'UH OH'. I mean really, you dont say? The panther was stolen from a ps 1 game from the looks. When you stealth kill people they freeze up and fall over, and the women have the same sounds as the men when they die. The health bar is a joke because sometimes i die in one hit with full health, other times i get hit 5 or 6 times and some how poor Garrys still kicking. This game is like torture to play. I bought it because i knew it would be bad, but never could i have imagined this bad. The amount of time I die from a glitch, or even for no reason what so ever, is outrageous. 1/10 One point for making me rethink my life, trying to figure out what lead to me buying this.P.S. This game made my guinea pig cry, I hope you're proud devs.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												THis game isn't good. At all. It tries to have a crafting system, but then the crafting system doesn't really even do much at all. And the things it does do, there's no way to find out how to craft them unless you just pure trail and error it. The story is god awful (at the start of the game, you have to untie yourself after being captured by tribals, AND THE GUY JUST STANDS THERE AND WATCHES YOU GET OUT), the animations are even worse than the story.The game also falls under the whole 'every game needs a gun' rule, apparently. Without even explaining it, you find an old flintlock pistol thing, and literally 2 minutes or less later you find a modern glock. I mean, what the hell is exactly happening in this game? And I just stopped playing after they make MONKEYS in the game the most dangerous thing. Don't buy, don't try. Also, there's a reason why the game dropped from 20 bucks to 5. Cash grab. Only reason I have is becasue they tricked my friend into thinking it was good and they bought it for me as a suprise... made me feel bad when I said that it was the worst game ever.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
												This truly is 'The Room' of videogames.Story Mode is filled with bugs and glitches, a very vague plot that you can't quite make out but with impeccable dialogue from the enthusiastic VA for Garry. Sometimes models will disappear from your hands, the crafting is all quick time events, for some odd reason the foliage sometimes grows in size and shrinks as you move closer.UDK showcases it's true beauty when you ALT+TAB and all the textures stretch to the moon and back, improving the gameplay quality ten-fold. The monkeys are all OP, the humanoid enemies deal a lot of damage but can just be easily outsmarted by moving slightly to the left or right and the panthers are quick time events with Garry yelling "IS THAT ALL YOU GOT?!"God forbid you try out the wonderful Survival Mode which consists of one loading screen, a lovely 5 second shot of Garry plunging into some beige looking void along with a very manly scream which then results in death and being sent back to whatever last save you had over in the Story Mode.There's no actual graphics options, just extras like V-Sync and Dynamic Shadows except for one box you can tick called Detail Mode which I suspect means "Do you want graphics?".I can't say I would or wouldn't recommend this game...it's an experience though I can tell you that.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me, "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 25, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Well, I gave it a fair shot. It's got an interesting environment and aesthetic style going for it, but it's presented in a really incompetent ♥♥♥♥♥♥ way. Really inconsistent framerate, bad or outright missing music and sound effects, really shoddy enemy AI, enemies take too many clumsy hits to kill, and lots of bugs. I decided to call it quits when I died and got stuck in a respawn loop of a loading screen and immediately falling under the game world, in an infinite gray space. The crafting mechanic seemed to be done in a kinda nice way (and I tend not to be that into these sorts of crafting survival games), but they are marred by too many quicktime events. And the story makes no sense. And the player character (Garry, I presume) has a lot of lame and unwelcome one-liners. And, well, yeah, it really is a sucky game, and I'm just adding to the gajillion other reviews that say the exact same thing.
