content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												I wish steam reviews would offer a sideways thumb option rather than a straight up/down thumb option, as I don't want to be forced to praise or condemn Day One: Garry's Incident. The deluge of derision this game has received is legendary and I don't want to be party to those kinds of criticisms. Does that mean Day One: Garry's Incident is a great game? Absolutely not. It's a severely mediocre game but certainly not as bad as other tried-and-true bad games.It feels more like a demo for something bigger but cut short by lack of funds or time (or both).Moreover, Day One feels like the developers couldn't settle on what kind of game they wanted to make. Is it a survival sim? No. It has a loose bit of "survival-lite" mechanics but that's about it. The survival aspect feels completely tacked on and has very little to do with the overall game or story. The survival mechanics are just a surrogate for more traditional ways of healing in other first-person adventures.Is it an FPS? Barely. As FPS goes Day One is clunky, slow and awkward. The weapons are uninspired and only the pistol and the alien blaster-thingy are any good. The other weapons are pretty useless. The enemies are It is a rip-roaring Indiana Jones-esque adventure? Maybe but the puzzles and traps are poorly designed as to suck any fun the game might have. The traps throughout are tedious trial-and-error speed bumps that force you to save often. The puzzles are dull and equally tedious; the temple complex in the second act, for example, forces the player to hunt down a half-dozen switches to open up the way to the next level, spread out over a ginormous Mayan temple that dwarfs the player that even running non-stop feels slow. Garry's Incident should be a lesson to its developers: develop a focus; fine tune your gameplay; make sure it's fun. This is where Garry's Incident fails. I can't help think if the developers had just made the effort they could have had a decent game on their hands but instead opted to make a quick buck and release it in a shoddy state.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												I saw the reviews and thought to myself that this game can't be as bad as people say. The game starts off with a nice intro sequence making you think that it was worth the money you spent on this, but when you get in game, the lack of effort put into this is phenomenal.Pros:- Okay graphics, I'm being modest. It kinda looks pretty. - Crafting, the crafting minigame is 10x better than the game itself. (it gets annoying after the first time though)- There's food. If that makes a change. I guess it's a nice feature.Cons:-Missing sounds, lots of audio bugs.-Missing textures, lots of graphical bugs.-The most threatening enemy are monkies. -AI for the human enemies are not intellegent at all. No pathfinding skills and has an area of awareness around them, making stealth impossible.-The weapons are the following: Bone Machete, Old Pistol (Flintlock pistol), Modern Pistol and a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed Alien Wristrocket. The bone machete doesn't do crap, the old pistol is a two hit kill and the modern pistol and wristrocket are 1 shot kills. You are way too OP in this game against the tribe people. -Lack of Explanation. Why did your plane crash and why the hell are the monkies OP and kill you slowly and silently? ( This would probably be explained if I finished the game, I just couldn't bring myself to do it)-Saving is trash. If you're saving to quit and play again another day, you'll be lucky to not find your save file corrupt. You have to play through Garry's Accident in one sitting.-The puzzles are annoying, extremley simple yet take forever to solve. - You have a hunger and Thirst bar but don't worry about getting food and water, they don't decrease because it's broken like this game overall. Don't buy this. I wanted to laugh at how bad this is but I can never get my money back, sadly. I even bought it on sale for $1 and it still wasn't even worth it. Seems like they spent a lot of their budget in the intro sequence because it's just a downward spiral from there.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												Day One: Garry's Incident does not fail because it's a bad game. It fails because it is an incomplete game. Parts of the game work well, and parts of it don't.Graphics: 6/10        In-game: 8\10        Cutscenes: 4\10The graphics in-game are genuinely beautiful, and I'm honestly surprised I got it to work this well on my computer, the cutscenes are a different story though... In the opening cutscene, Garry clearly dumps his liquor onto his crotch before drinking from it, and his other movements simply look unnatural.Sound Design: 4\10        Voice Acting: 6\10        Sound Effects: 2\10The voice acting, while not AAA, professional quality, is adequate. The sounds are adequate as well, when they work. Half the time, it seems that the sound effects simply cut out.Gameplay: 6\10        Combat: 3\10        Controls: 9\10I had absolutely no problems controlling the game, except for the overuse of quick-time events, but I had actually never experienced them before, so I'm not sick of them yet. The combat is set up so that you have two kinds of attacks and one way to block, but you can take out most enemies with the first attack alone, since it stuns them long enough for you to hit them again. MINOR SPOILER ALERT: The scene where the temple is collapsing around you at the beginning is genuinely awesome.Stability: 1\10Here's where the game really has its problems. Bugs are everywhere. Rather than an in depth analysis of them, I'll just tell you my experiences with them.Dies, loads autosave, falls out of the world, repeat about five times before I manage to shut down the game.Loads save file, encounters frozen tribe leader, opens inventory, game freezes, weeps silently.Low on health, uses bandages, ceiling caves in while I'm using them, finishes bandaging myself up, teleports to the sacraficial table without my pistol and magic gauntlet, weeps openlyEnjoyability: 7\10If you like bad games, or are looking for a joke gift for a friend, this game is perfect. Or if you like survival games and are willing to look beyond what are admittedly huge flaws then you could get some enjoyment out of it.Overall: 4.8\10Overall, if you're looking for the next great survival game, you will be disappointed. But if you've heard how infamous this game is and still want to try it, you will get what you're looking for.

												Holy god. I bought this game for 3$ on steam (had a dollar in my wallet no clue how) and my god let me tell you something about this masterpiece. The challenge isn't like all of those yesteryear products that force you to deal with the games mechanics or clear cut challenges. Nope. This game, just figuring out what you can do is the challenge. I dont know where they came up with the idea for this iconic title, but let me tell you now, it belongs in the history books!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												I really wanted to like this game, it looked like it had a good deal of promise. I thought $4 was a good price to pay for it, that it was worth a shot at that price. I was wrong. Very wrong.I should have listened to the overwhelming array of negative reviews. It seems to be using an old Unreal engine, like maybe the Unreal 2 engine or something, and the controls are just awkward. There are slowdowns (for seemingly no reason), long loading times, and this all spells a bad experience without even getting into the poor graphic quality and poor audio quality (yes, I know it's indie, I took that into account).Trying to exit the game after my 47 minutes of buggy playtime was an experience in itself. My system hung on a black screen for around 10 minutes (couldn't even CTRL+ALT+DEL), and my computer was slow for another 10 or so minutes after that with the harddrive being hammered the whole time. It even managed to crash the audio driver in Ventrillo (which I was logged into in the background). The error message said something about too much data being forced through the sound driver.Overall, my experiences with Day One were not unique, and I just cannot recommend this game to anyone.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 6, 2014
												While, in the bottom of my heart, i want to say GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD, but in this case, I can't. Do no buy this game. It's just not worth it. Not because it's bad, it's just not worth $20 for 2 to 3 hours of gameplay. I can't even explain this game. When I started playing, I knew it was poorly made. However, I had to beat it. The so called "Story" just wasn't there. You do not do anything! You just wonder around looking for anything. The only thing you actually do is solve the "puzzels" to get to the next part. Food and Water are barely even an issue. When you complete each part of the area, and you start the others, you get full health and hydration. It is too easy to actually finish this chapter without actually having to eat or drink. I looked a few things up about this game and learned that the creator plans to do multiple chapters. Word of advice creator, if you plan to make more chapters after this one, for the love of god do it right. Take your time, and for the love of god, DO NOT CHARGE $20 DOLLARS FOR IT! 2 to 3 hours of clunky gameplay is not a good idea! For god sakes, The Walking dead only charged $5 for their chapters! That should be the most you charge. Good luck everyone who bought this and goodluck to you creator if you plan on making more games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 21, 2013
												game is extremely awkward to play (controls and playstyle)the crafting system is a horrible and isn't as good as it is advertised and proves to be next to uselessthe game's physics are so overdone that it made my computer lag (one that can run skyrim with a ton of texture and physics booster mods including more and better foliage, realistic water particles, hi-res textures, light bloom and the like with no visible lag) as well as one that can support BF4the game could have been a wonderful survival adventure game, hower the sci-fi aspect was pushed way too far and the interaction system is horrible (need to focus on a single point on an object in order to interact with it)the mouse and keyboard controls are clunky and awkward to use, the mouse isn't as responsive and smooth as it should be, and the gamepad controls aren't any betterThe graphics are decent but as stated before they implemented an extremely high amount of physics into this where there didn't need to be any, I wish they had put as much time that they had into the environment, into the engine and gameplayI say 1/10 at least the thing ran (barely) Definitely not worth the money and I wish I hadn't bought it

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												Do not buy this. Literally, i got this for $2.49 and i still feel ripped off. I got this because i genuinely love survival games, even the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ones. But this is bad. I'll talk about the things i hated first. First off is the framerate. It's atrocious. The settings are not user friendly, and even on the lowest settings, it still runs like♥♥♥♥♥♥ Second is the animations, they look absolutely glorious. Honestly, if you want a laugh, swing your machete around a bit. it al looks like a dead body being controlled by a mass of wrigling fish inside them. Third, is the gameplay. This is how you kill everything. Swing machete, swing machete, and repeat until they comically fall over.  The only unique enemy is the panther. It jumps on you out of ♥♥♥♥ing nowhere and you do an incredibly easy quick time event to jam your machete into its throat. Also, the crafting is also ran by quicktime events, and even they are minimalistc. Finally, its filled to the brim with game breaking bugs. Also the voice acting is some of the worst I've ever heard.BUT, there are things i liked. The setting is great, and not done nearly enough. A greenery filled jungle is a great place to have a game! The concept itself is quite sound, if not 100% original. Basically, you crash your plane and now have to survive in a jungle full of unfriendly almost naked brown people! of course it is. And the music (the main menu music at least), i have to admit, is actually reallly great!In the end, this is Far Cry 3 if you made it not fun, and added a food  meter. unless it's literally 1 dollar, don't get it. A great concept doesn't excuse it from bein a great game. There are redeeming factors about this game, but they're buried under♥♥♥♥♥♥ Monkey♥♥♥♥♥♥ That kills you. 3/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2014
												Okay, this is one of the situations, where I gotta say that 2 bucks are too much paid for this.There's bugs all over the place, and it's just...stupid.I mean, I couldn't get out of the first freakin' room!The battle system is so bad too.. Also, why do dead HUMAN enemies respawn after reloading?Then, the girl you can rescue, which doesn't do anything at all?? And I could kill her the first time. And her corpse was screaming as I attacked her dead body, which..I should blame voodoo for..?So, another big problem with this game is, that when you just want to heal yourself, you have to mash buttons, and the right buttons, and that's annoying as hell. Did it try to be realistic there? Because in real life, you have all time of the world to just bandage your damn arm.Then there was this scene, where you have to duck and attack someone from behind, and you'd assume, he dies with one hit, just like in other games like that, but he didn't even seem to get more damage or anything. He survived as much as the first enemy. And again, why do they respawn, when you reload?!?So, you have to press 3 stone buttons and a shiny glove appears, which makes the building collapse. You take a lot of damage from being hit by whatever falls down at you. And when you want to heal yourself, you...need to do that♥♥♥♥♥♥with the button triggers again.. So, it's hard to get out.I saved right after I took the glove, and..kinda before the cutscene that makes the building collapse.When I reload, I have the glove, but the building isn't collapsing, and I can't get out.I wonder, if there's anything good about this game. In general, it feels like a rip-off mix.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												I give it a 2/10, 3/10 if I want to be optimistic. Gameplay tends to be laggy and uninspiring, and what little plot there is seems woefully lacking in terms of storytelling elements.  An information that *might* be useful in learning how to play via pop ups, which tend to trigger about half a minute after they would've been of use.  Combat elements are simple enough, but the lack of telegraphing tends to make melee fights a matter of luck more than skill...  And the game in general seems prone to various bugs.I bought this for roughly $1 USD while it was for 90% off... and I'm not sure I got my money's worth. :/

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												This is actually an achievement. No, really. Seriously. This game is an achievement.Think about how far we've come as a medium. Think about the unfathomable number of man-hours invested in learning about game design, the massive leaps in technology, the unending array of middleware available for developers of all levels. Think about how much awful shovelware existed for old systems, think about how many games were made by people who had no idea what they were doing, think about how many commecial products came out that simply Did Not Work.It is an honest-to-god achievement, in this day and age, to release a game that is an honest-to-god contender for Worst Game Ever.Day One: Garry's Incident, you are gaming history. Congratulations.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												This is Temple Run out of the map in first-person.  Your first mission is to get out of a temple after you've killed some indian-egypt-african-aztec-dude, who for some reason doesn't know how to tie a rope probably so you can't escape. Why the f* can't he do that, when he has lived in the jungle since he was brought into that weird world by his mother when she died. --- And i say when she died, because everytime you kill a chick it sounds like she gives birth to an idiotic child with rabies. You only know what to do in the start and the rest of the game you run around and a pretend you're Bear Grylls lost on Madagascar. There's seriously monkeys running around throwing mangos at you, because they don't feel like eating that god damn mango. If i had a mango right now i would eat it. Those monkeys are some little unthankful c*nts and i hope they get stuck in some top secret mayan stone-trap and get crushed by a giant rock until their eyes pop out.But this thing actually is has a positive side too! You wouldn't believe it would you? Well.. If you don't have money for a Far Cry-game and just want cut animals open, you can do that! There's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pumas running around the jungle, which you can skin with the exact same animation they use in Far Cry! Though it's really bad because it's "Day One: Garry's Incident". They should call it "10 minutes: That's the game".Anyways.. This is great game! ... *cough* if you got dropped as a child on the floor *cough*.By the way. Why does the main character have so huge hands? Like really. It's like he's Bigfoots cousin.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												This is the worst game on Steam. Not kidding. Not just trying to say this is bad.This IS the WORST GAME ON STEAM. CONS:-Audio for the game is recorded with a 1€ mic. The voice acting in this game are made by the least enthusiastic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ever. Period. When reading this, say "uh get of me.", in your normal voice. Do it right now please. Congratulations, thats just what you'll hear when being attacked by a jaguar in this game. -Aimations are rough and AI must have been scripted by a 5-10 year old in 3 hours. I've never seen such horrible AI in a "Game" before.- Gameplaywise it's a mess. - Crafting is pretty much non existant. It's more of something you do to progress. Could just have been a table with a sign that says "Press here to craft to move on".-Handgun seems to be loaded with blanks.-Natives (back on the AI part) forget you if you walk to far away so you can enter the village and everyone charges you, kill one, run 10 feet back so they forget you and repeat. -Frequent crashes.-Sometime had to restart the game in order to progress.-Some stuff make no sense, for example you can trade with the first native you come across and she poses no threat, ALL others are just going to KOS and blindly run into gunfire.-No real "Mystery" Just scripted ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t that gives more of a "uhm... ok? why?" feeling. Pros:Decent meshes and textures. Procons:Not tried the new gamemode yet. "Yet" as in "i'll never install this again over my dead body but if i do die and can still operate my body or computer i might install it to haunt the next person that starts my computer and checks my library. But not yet."Overall 10/10Pay me Wild Games Studio

content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												This is the worst game I have ever payed actual money for. There are invisible walls that prevent exploration, bugged out natives with infinitely small hitboxs, & if the game crashes on you (which is a sad reality you must get used to if you plan on playing this game) there is a potential for the quest item you must pick up or wuest enemy you must kill to either disappear or spawn dead when you reboot the game. Guess what happens if you can't get the quest item or kill the quest enemy anymore. You can't complete the quest. & because this is a mainly quest driven game, you either start a new game or get comfortable in video game Limbo (the state in which a game is no longer winnable due to bugs or game errors). Trust me. You do not want to restart this game. DO NOT BUY! 0/10

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												At first I was "recommending" this game for laughs, but later I was having deeper thoughts about this filth. I can't actually recommend it at all.. Why? Because this game is an insult to gaming in general, malicious joke and complete waste of time. Day One: Garry's Incident tests your humanity, patience, sanity and self-respect. I don't encourage anyone to buy it. Please, if you've any brain cells left in your head, do not spend a single coin on this abomination. But if someone evil enough sends this game to you as a "gift" or you find a dirt-cheap bundle that has some awsome games with this abomination included... Take it! Try the game for yourself and see how awful it is! The videos you see in youtube is not enough. You just have to experience it yourself, but you might regret having this game in your library later.The only good thing about Day One: Garry's Incident is that after you spend 1 hour of playing it, you find yourself loving all awsome better games you already own even more...

content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
												Most of the reviews are from people that played less than an hour. Well, I've played more. I don't know why. I guess I was as drunk as the dude in the game. Either way, it's two hours of my life that I will never get back, and hours of crappy game play that I can never unsee. Please, save yourselves, don't do it. I mean, it SOUNDS good. It could have been a great game... if you know, they didn't do EVERYTHING wrong. I bought it thinking... "It can't be that bad, and besides, I have found some great games that everyone else has said is crap". Nope. I was wrong. It IS that crap. I refuse to even steamgift it when it's cheap. I wouldn't wish this game on my worst enemy. I think it's best if we all forget about it, have it removed from steam, and pretend it never happened... like the copies of ET burried in the desert. Except let's never go looking for them. And we don't tell stories of it to our children, for fear that they may find the Game O Crap.It could have been so good...

content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
												I love games; simply said. i needed to play 5 min just to write the review but so far have played a couple hours. Its not as bad as the reviews put out. Game only crashed once, and i got stuck under the rocks at the very beginning after i picked up the arm weapon because i did not move right away, and i did not die. but so far quite smooth. hopefully it was just a hiccup. I will complete garry's incident, i just got it despite all those terrible reviews and will give a detailed truth be told opinion of this game from an old school gamer. Downloading now....... i have been playing video games since calecovision and atari 2600, my first computer was a tandy, took 10 hours to program hangman to play for 5 min. And now... On my 360, have been and was the all time gears of war #1 ranked in all ranked matches for 3 years solid. Hope my review helps.ok So far, I have journeyed into the wilderness into some unknown amazon, with crazy lil monkeys and panthers that race out of no where at you. Paint faced tribunal men that look like cannibals, and the freindly villiage people. Garrys Incident is not that bad, I am still going to finish this game, may take me a while as i play mulitiple games, but i will. So far its not bad. I am not sure where the developer was going with this as it is like other games, just an amateur version. Its a wonder that unreal engine is not being used to its fullest potential as i know from personal experience that unreal engine is sleek, with very fast elements for certain games, like Unreal tournament. I could say this would be a great first timer game getting into these types of games i guess as it seems quite hard, But to support a developer for 2 bucks is ok by me, so essentially i just bought a coffee. So far the game is actually quite hard, the crazy cannibals keep freaking me out i tried to sneak up on one but i can not seem to sneak attack, as soon as he knows your there its game on, its like the dude has just gone on insane mode, the reviews about garry's incident should be re-evaluated as i am not sure if people just have a hate on for the developer or not but i am sure these people are hatin cause they die, just like i have been, So if you think your getting ripped off, really your not as i have seen poopier games cost way more, when you think of the time, budget allowed, coding, animations, how many are working on it plus the payout of developers time really when you think about it, its change that he is making in the end of all the costs, If you enjoy games and story lines then i am 80% sure you will see what i see. But for overall grafic's its ok, but not great. i play on the highest settings but still does not really affect the game that much other than clear everything up but still pixels. I hope the devs really appreciate my review, I am quite a critic in life and can not say its as bad as everyone is saying, it just needs a little TLC and maybe some good freinds for moral support. You have a great engine to use there dev, so please use it. I am sure you did not get your education to be ridiculed over a game, personally i got this game because of all the bad reviews, it was almost forcing me to buy it as i wanted to make sure a hidden gem was not being disgruntled for no reason, It may not be a diamond, but it does shine, just needs some polish, plus you devs should also have youtube videos to support this game. I honestly could give donation coding to you if you like as i also used to do this for a hobby, and would even sign a waiver that you have all rights to the coding i give ya, i know legals and do not mind helping out behind the lines with no need for credit in any way other than the fact i could tell my grandkids about it. just not professionally but could have as i did get an interview with epic in toronto years ago when i applied through my xbox360, had no where to live after i got there, plus knew no one so i did not bother, i just kept on lobster fishing and working for a domain name provider.  I did catch the bottle of jack daniels at the beginning clearly labled as it used to be my favorite drink. So cheers, lets make some boiler makers... or apple jacks If you do not know what a boiler maker is ill tell ya... 2 Oz of jack daniels 1 Bottle of beer. 1 large enough glass to hold all of the beer and the shot glass. Fill glass with cold beer. ready yourself... drop the shot in the glass of beer. as soon as you see the shot glass is on the bottom, takes 1 sec chug your glass as fast as you can to empty.....apple jacksyour favorite ice cold apple juice or cidermix with jack #7 to taste mmmm let me know how many you could handle if you try it....

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
												I preordered this game and was pretty intrigued of what it offered because I do love stuff similar to Indiana Jones, basically everything which is about jungles and exploring. I started to play this game and managed to finish it. I was pleasantly surprised of the game, if you get past the glitches, random bugs and silly like voices and sounds and gameplay it is actually pretty nice game, although ending was like from a scifi movie and really didn't fit the game to be honest. Yes the game has it's problems but to me it was a good four and half hour experience with laughs there and there, half of that time I was running lost in the jungle not knowing where to go and what to do until I figured out the route. Would I recommend the game to my friends, well maybe not because not many actually would like it which is a shame. But my point of this review is that if it is on sale, lets say 75% off give it a shot, couple of bucks really isn't that much for a half broken game. I only wish sequel would be made or that it was longer.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2015
												It's actually a very good game. My $7,000,000,000 computer over at NASA can run this game at a smooth 20fps. The combat and stealth systems are completely flawless. I believe that they worked very hard on these stealth and combat controls. The combat is very fast paced and definitaly puts your life on the line. The tactic that always works for me personally, is to crouch as soon as I can low health. This way, the enemies can't hit me. I can then easily run away to the camp. When I do decide to fight, its very difficult and makes my heart race. As long as I keep hitting the enemy, they won't move. At all. Overall, this is a great game. Just fix the god damn monkeys, holy crap their poop does a lot of damage. 10/10, would buy this game for all of steam.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												I don't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥about other people's opinion to cloud my own opinion, I wanted to know it for myself if this game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥ or not. And for a price where you buy a hamburger for which is done in a few minutes, I wanted to see and experience this game myself.The title screen was promising, I thought it was a zombie survival game, put when the gameplay started I was surprised. Nevertheless, I gave it shot. There were some rage moments (thus challenges to overcome), the puzzles were easy but some of them are almost impossible because of hitboxes that it made me almost quit the game entirely. But I kept playing it. The game evolved into a strange put urgent situation that I had to finish it, I don't know why. Took me 4.3 hours, most of the time is at that spot where the hitboxes are ♥♥♥♥ed up and another level which was surprisingly extremely fun. I once got stuck at a certain point where I had to restart the game 10 times but eventually finished it and I must say that the game has potention but it's not quite visible. And 30% of it was extremely entertaining.Do I recommend it? Yes and no, but I do wait for the next episode!!! Can't wait! Developers? Don't see those bad reviews as a sign to stop making the next episode, learn from them instead. I am sure, the second episode will be a blast!But the game is playable to the end and it can entertain you for a few hours, in comparisation with the money you pay for it.I understand why people hate this game, don't be spoiled, the game has potention but is a bit worked out poorly. But it also has a lot of details, a lot of unneeded details in fact, but still. I had, unlike the complications it sometimes had, fun. YES! I HAD FUN!!! So there you have it, take it or leave it. Every person is different and you might be one of them, that appreciates a game like this.

												I stoped playing the game when I shot a small basket and the bullet rebounded and hit me in the head killing me.This was after around 2 hours of playing I had a good feel for the game,I knew how to craft how to shoot and what the game had to offer. I highly doupt anyone has ever played this game to the end because it is much harder then dark souls,It puts take down red saber to shame.Not because the game is really that hard you have 5 ways to attack all work fine.1.Is you stick machte thing:You get this right away, it lets you swing and block is good when you are fighting the monkys.2.The magic wristband thingy:This is like some sort of big blast that can take out any enemy in one shot but you can only rechagre it at these stone things but this one time I used it died then when I reloaded my save I was still out of ammo even though the save was before I shot it,so great is breaks the game to.3.The handgun: This thing allways acts like its hitting mettal even on peoples heads,other then that its a probly the best way to kill anything because its 2 shots vs the natvies and lets you shoot one shot after another.4.The double barrle shot gun pistol thing:This is the weakest ranged wepon and allways acts like your are hitting someone and making them bleed,even if you are shooting a rock,so it gives rocks blood great.5.Blowgun: I guess this is for stealth I never got to use it much but Its if you want to sneak.So ya you can handdle anything they though at you if you use anyone of these,no the game is hard because its just boring.Runing around the woods can get anoying because it all looks the same,and this is because you dont have a map,the game trys to tell you where to go with signs but they are hardly going to make it any better.If you play this game you will break,this game is one of a kind and can be marked up there with ride to hell retrubution.That being said I had more fun with this then ride to hell,because that game was so long and boring that it took far to long to get to some of the funny stuff later on.But this game thoughs evrey funny thing that can happen right away, if you alt tab at any time you go to limbo land,there is no sounds when the temple at the start of the game explodes,there is plenty of random and funny stuff that you can do in this game.So yes I totaly recommend this game if you want a good laugh,I feel bad for the people made this game,he just wanted people to like his game,he just wanted to be notcied,he even payed people who could survive in the game for several days in the games survival mode.This game just had bad luck around the time it came out and really does not desrve the hate it gets when games.Games like ride to hell are just called *jokes*, despite the fact that ride to hell can be offensive,this game is just buggy.But thats the thing you wont last long in this game it will  break you,but if you can get this game for less then 5 bucks (hopefully like 2$ bucks like I did) then its a good deal.Its more fun then call of duty,its more funny then goat simulator,its more garry then garrys mod.If you like games like warz,goat simulator,ride to hell,two worlds,sonic 06,elder scrolls 4 oblivion,and other such so bad they are good games,then you owe your self to check this one out!(This review as said above is before I beat the game,so I will update the game when I get around to beating it)

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
"Uhhh howbout I press dis button?"Let's face it. When we hear "Day One: Garry's Incident", we groan in agony. No one wants to suffer this abomination. It's a glitchy mess! It's like Far Cry's fourteenth cousin twice removed. Is it bad? Yes. It is. But, that's the thing. It's so bad, it's good. Because it's so bad, it's hilarious. It's all in good fun if you don't take it seriously.Now let's get down to business (A.K.A. the first five minutes of the game):You play as Garry, some middle-aged man who flies a plane over this inconspicious island. He's going to deliver some wooden crates. To where? No one knows. A volcano erupts, causing the island to explode, and a crate glows, creating a portal that somehow saves Garry's life. And now Garry is captured by male island natives, and they bring him to this temple. Garry is binded in rope. He gets himself free. He has himself a battle with a male islander that thinks he's a worthy opponent against Garry's bone machete. The islander dies a fabulous death. Garry saves a tribal female. Thus, you begin your journey as Garry.What was the incident that occurred that involved Garry? Who the hell knows?There are trading cards. That means you can craft a badge. That means you can get a Garry-rific background for your profile. That means you can get a few cents for your wallet funds. Chances are you'll get the Garry card for all three card drops. That happened to me. That's my incident.If you want stupid and pointless fun, get this while it's on sale.

number of helpful: 4 of 14 people (29%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												I feel like this game gets a bad rap. It really doesn't deserve all the hate. Here's a run down of the game and may I tell you now it can have a few spoilers so be warned.Day One: Garry's Incident takes place on a beautiful, luscious, eye candy of an island with amazing visuals and sound design that you really feel like you are in the world. You play as a character respectfully known as Garry. (I personally think he is a hunk, I would bury my face in that teddy bear beard of his and never let go of him. Garry is my true lord and savior and I would give up everything to be with him forever). Now, you crash land on an island after a giant anomaly hits Garry's plane, but miraculously he survives, and is taken in by a group of very nice tribal men who offer him tea and buiscets for the small small price of his squishy anal virginity. He refuses and they strap him down, man handling him like never before and they take him on a true ride. Now here is a big spoiler, the tribal men who are pretty hunky themselves have some fairly large horse♥♥♥♥♥♥♥which they release upon Garry, but he manages to break free from his restraints and take down what used to be the nicest men he had ever met. (They had sweet smiles that may have been semi-erotic but we will never know because Garry killed the ♥♥♥♥ out of them. And possibly had his way with them. Necrophelia is a huge fetish of mine.) This is where Garry escapes the tomb he had been soccumbed into, and he embarks on a journey to find true love, adventure, and hard liqour.Thank you for reading my review! I put a lot of time and effort in both the game and this review and I hope you enjoy Day One: Garry's Incident as much as I did! Oh! And before I forget, the game runs at a beautiful and constant 130 Frames, and never drops. It works surprisingly well. And the enemy AI is extremely smart. Seeking you out, and throwing grenades in mass in whichever trench or fox hole you wind up in. Reminds me of the good ol' World At War days. Except they throw fart bombs. More deadly. More silent. Anyways...I rate this game a 9 out of 10, the only thing lacking is the amount of playtime that you can put in without there being music, I heard the game has a massive beautiful sound track conducted by Hans Zimmer, the guy who did the MW2 soundtrack (Which I love so much!) but I guess theres a bug. But I trust these dev's will hammer out that little minor bug and get the sexy tunes rolling into my ears soon enough. Well, until next time!

number of helpful: 5 of 17 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
												After finishing this game, I have to say, that I cannot agree with ANY of the reviews I have seen for this game. Truthfully, I originally only purchased this game so that I could 'experience' it myself, as everyone said it was absolutely terrible and that I should "Buy a sandwich instead" (I got it on sale for 1.89 euro), but upon actually playing it myself, I enjoyed it and wanted to go back and play it again as soon as I got home from school. Sure, Healing was a pain as it took about 20 seconds to do, and at one point about 30 monkeys spawned at once and drove me insane, but the game as a whole was enjoyable. There's stealth (Not very realistic stealth mind you, but it felt good to sneak up behind an enemy and watch him/her tumble to the ground), Puzzles, exploration, crafting, food and water meters and large maps to make you really feel like you're lost in the jungle. The fighting wasn't the most exciting thing ever, but it wasn't hard or frustrating either. Once you get the M9, 2 shots and you've killed a guy. One shot for the animals. It allowed me to go through the levels without ever feeling stressed or annoyed, which, to me, is a good thing. Maybe I just got lucky, but the game only crashed once, and there were little to no bugs that I encountered throughout the whole game. I got out of the map at one point, but that can happen in any game (Skyrim being one) and doesn't make the game any worse (Better if anything! Getting out of the map is fun). The game also ran at full fps with near max settings for me so that wasn't a problem either. I know how hard it is to develop a game (I am a developer myself), and so I think they did a really good job considering they're just a small indie company, and it's terrible to see just how rude, disrespectful and heartless people are when it comes to this game. Sure, I found them funny when I first saw them, as I had never seen what the game was really like, but those comments prevent others from wanting to try the game (Myself included), which is unfair to both the developers and the people who are missing out.Is it worth 19 euro? Not at all. Was it worth the 1.89 euro that I bought it for? Every last cent. Heck, I'd pay 10 euro for this game and not feel dissapointed! Again, maybe I got lucky, but I really do recommend you try this game yourself next time it's on sale and see if YOU think it's as bad as everyone has stated.If I were to give this a proper rating, I'd give it about a 8/10 (Keeping in mind that it is only an indie game). It was very enjoyable and challenging at times, with good platforming parts, interesting puzzles, hidden secrets and easy but satisfying combat, but it's unnecessary crafting, long healing times, quick-time events, short game length (I finished it in less than 3hrs) and high asking price (Buy it when it's one sale) hold it back from being any higher of a score. However, I still highly recommend you give it a go yourself when you get a chance.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												Garry's Day Out received mainly negative reviews from critics, and holds a 21% "rotten" approval rating at the review website Rotten Tomatoes, with 3 positive reviews from 14.On the Siskel & Ebert show, critic Roger Ebert wrote that "'Garry's Day Out' contains gags that might have worked in a Garry Herman cartoon, but in live action, with real people, taxis, buses, streets, and a real Garry, they're just not funny. The Worton twins are adorable as Garry Bink, however; the audience produced an audible coo the first time they saw him on the screen." He gave the film 1 1/2 stars. His partner, Gene Siskel, however, liked the film because he thought that young children will love it for the survival elements.Also, not all other reviews were negative. Hal Hinson, writing for the Washington Post wrote, "The pace is quick and efficient but never frantic...almost everything in the picture is just right, including the two-bit crooks who abduct the incidental man and end up bruised and begging hilariously for mercy. Best of all, though, is the Binkman himself, whose tiny face is so expressive that he brings new meaning to the phrase 'conquering with a gun.'"In 2010, popular internet reviewers RedLetterMedia delivered a scathing video critique of the film, drawing negative comparisons to The Three Stooges, Looney Tunes, and Home Alone.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												This game has potential but the execution is very rough around the edges. Imho this game should have been marketed as early access or released on Desura first (for a low price) instead of Steam.This being said, the game is fun to play despite its roughness. The crafting is actually quite good and it is well integrated into the survival element.The graphics and sound are rough but not horrible, they do the job.The combat could have used some balance and tweaking and just like the rest of the game...its rough around the edges but its passable, it does the job and you know what? I have seen worse combat than this in some very popular games that i will refrain from naming.Maybe because of the interesting setting and very good base idea, the game feels better than the sum of its parts.Given the reviews it got, i bought it mostly out of curiosity to see how horrible it could actually be and to my surprise it ended up being not so bad at all.Its definitely worth the $2 it sells for right now.If i was to rate it based on execution and presentation i would have to give it a 4 or 5.But if i was to rate it based on the fun i had playing it, it would be an easy 7.I chose to "recommend" this game for two reasons: it got too many unfairly negative reviews and for $2 it is indeed recommendable.

number of helpful: 2 of 12 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												I think this game receives too much flak, people bandwagoning on a hate train created by popular Youtubers. Sure, it is not perfect, but nothing truly is. I see this to be like another Bubsy 3D, a gem that is simply thrown into the trash by people with unrealistic standards. Not everyone can create a Triple A budget title, and have to make do with the tools available to them. And in this regard, I see Day One: Garry's Incident as a rather fine title. If I were to change only one thing, it would be  to have multiple areas which would load separately, so not to stress the system too much. This simple fix could turn this B- game into an A for me.Don't fall victim to this blackhole of negativity. This is hardly one of the worst games ever, like so many claim. I mean, if it were that bad, it'd have been taken off Steam by now, like so many other titles. Such as Ride to Hell and War Z.To conclude my report, this game is a fine deal for the low price it is at. Just do not expect it to be on par with something like the Nathan Drake series, which I feel this is very comparable to in terms of setting, themes, and characters.Thank you for reading, and I hope anyone who decides to purchase this title will see the positives to it. Such as a nice variety of weapons, a crafting system, and survival mode which I feel surpasses that of Rust, Garry's other project.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												When you play the game first and then watch the trailer, you notice how many sound effects are missing in the game. Such as the panther growling when it attacks you. It doesn't in the game, it in fact makes no sound at all. And a lot of sounds are missing from the game. You can never hear the enemy approaching you, because nothing is heard from them. I once got attacked by one tribeswoman and was killed by a second, as the second was hitting me from behind and I had no idea she was there.The combats are weird to say the least. You have no idea how much the enemy is injured or if you injure them. I shot a tribeswoman 4 times with a gun and she kinda flinched in pain, then not only walked (well, the tribespeople moonwalk in this game... ), but she ran back to her tribe when she noticed me. When she returned and attacked me, I stabbed her twice and she fell over dead.Gun bullets appearently can't travel more than 3 metres in front of your character, as I tried to shoot two tribesmen who were clearly in shooting range, but my bullets.. um... magically disappeared? There was also this tribeleader who was trying to kill me, so I stabbed him repeatedly, and he looked a bit offended until he fell over dead. And appearently you can't make fire with a lighter and a piece of cloth. And our hero who knows how to fly an airplane doesn't know the basics of making a campfire. His response to discovering that a lighter can't put a cloth on fire? ”UH OH!”The game isn't ”awful funny” enough for me to continue playing it and it wasn't interesting either.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 24, 2014
												Scores are at the bottom.Setting:  You are Garry; an alcoholic mourning the loss of his family.  One afternoon, you go for a plane ride on business to deliver a few things.  All of a sudden, a volcano erupts, and the turbulence bring you down.  Even though you were certain to die, a strange package activates an ancient power in an attempt to save you.  You wake up, about to be sacrificed to an aboriginee tribe's deity.  You notice that there was something even stranger about these people.  You free yourself, kill your opposition, and solve an ancient puzzle that hides an ancient weapon.  The temple caves in, and you just barely escape death for the second time.  This is where the game begins.Review:Usually, when I see a game with such negative reviews, I'm ever tempted to buy it, just so I can confirm the reviews are honest.  I had just gotten a USD $50 gift card for Steam.  I bought the games I wanted, and had USD $4 remaining or so.  I'm very impatient when I have money, so I had to find something to spend it on.  This game, along with Takedown: Red Sabre, came on sale for USD $1.49 each.  I caved, and bought both.  I will tell you, the time I have in this game was real play time; not just letting it run for cards.  That was just compensation for the time I wasted in this game.I usually appologize or beg to be heard out for giving a negative review, but I feel it's not necessary here.  As soon as you load the game, you notice your framerate drop tremendously, even on higher performance PCs.  After you find a way to stablize your framerate, you begin the game.  You see a dream of your character's wife calling to him.  The dream ends, and you see your character.  It's obvious that cutscenes were a last minute idea for the game.  I've seen more stable animation in Garry's Mod.  Why, oh why do you share this man's name, Garry?  The voice acting is less than pleasent, and the graphics are horrendous on all but the highest performance PCs.  The story is not well put together, but passable.  The inventory system is interesting, and is good in concept, but severely lacking in implementation.  The bad combat system and bountiful amount of bugs almost rival that of Aquaman: Battle For Atlantis.  Almost.  Oh, who am I kidding; nothing is worse than that.  The plus, however, is that the game does have a good soundtrack.  That alone may save it from getting eternally condemned to the less than 4/10 zone.Scores:Story: 5/10Stability (Lack of Bugs): 2/10Stability (Performance): 2/10Combat System: 3/10Soundtrack: 8/10Replay Value: Undecided...Final Score: 4/10.Recomended buy price:  Undecided...Final Thoughts:That was honestly unintended.  I consider a game "condemned to death" if their overall score goes below 4/10 (even if it's 3.9999999999999999999999999999999) which is generous, considering most people say that about 6/10 games and sometimes even higher rated games.  I cannot recommend this game.  I will play it again, if at least just to complete the story mode and establish the score for replay value.  If you genuinely want to judge this game for yourself, I won't (and can't) stop you from buying it.  I do, however, recommend that you AT LEAST buy it when it's on sale for USD $1.49.

												Cannot recommend this game.The gameplay is solid. The plot seems okay, if a bit odd. But the controls are finicky: aiming is odd, and it doesn't seem to matter where you aim. And everything is accomplished via quicktime events, up to and including healing yourself, which is a ~20s ordeal just to recover half health. And to create the bandages is itself a 10-15s activity.Besides that, the devs seem to have... forgotten sound. If you're standing still, there is no sound at all, and when moving it's like footsteps echoing in an empty room. No breathing, no ambient sounds, nothing. Basically, it's ok overall, but the silence is offputting and the QTEs, the low quality animation and the shoddy controls put this at bargain-bin levels.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Day One: Garry's Incident ReviewNOTICE: This is the one game I will not follow my standard of 3 hour gameplay, it is so bad and unplayable, I cannot continue to play it.Gameplay:You are in the middle of delivering a package and a volcano goes boom. You awaken being dragged by the low end of models and are a sacarifice. Then I have no idea what happens next... You do something and it bugs out. I cannot complete a mission even if all of the things are done. So I was walking around for nothing.Gamemodes:Yes there are game modes, Story mode and Survival mode.Story:Like I said for gameplay, Story is broken. You are also an alcoholic and have a dead falmily, for whatever reason that is too clichéd in today's games. for the first startup, a mission was to kill a panther and give it to a tribeswoman for your alcohol flask that does nothing in the game to ease the thirst meer. You killed it with a QTE(Quick-Time Events) that were awful and no randomness. And would complete the mission, and no meat was taken... What? I booted it for the second time and things were slightly working better. Oh, and no way to get me out of the second chapter in the game.Survival: You have to survive for the longest time possible. That is all you have to do. The way you find things are pointless. I cant even find sitcks to even build a fire. Yet I could pull them down IF this was a real life event. I cant complete it and cannot do anything.Graphics & Performance:Graphics settings on max settings are still awful to look at. There is a compass on the HUD that does noting other than look important. Performance is barely achieving 30+ FPS according to the Steam Beta FPS counter. Loading times are not very short. View distance is very short. It is goes like this for the example of Grass: no grass other than floor texture for 15 ft. Then some grass 15 ft to 10 ft. then some medium quality grass at 10 ft. to 5 ft. then some "high" quality grass from 5 ft. in. Models are low quality and break if you Alt+Tab out of the game. Floor texture hates that and can go crazy, some weapons like the gauntlet can dissapear and only have the hand. While charging the weapon up, there is the most annoying lens flare that makes the screen fill with lots of blue... When you shoot the gun, It always thinks that there is a person or NPC that is killable, so red comes out of of where you shot it, no matter a tree or the ground.Controls:Nothing to me is entirely wrong with the keyboard controls other than the crouching., which is a toggle and I hate toggles. The mouse sensitivity is AWFUL. i require games to have the game sensitivity to be ignored and use the hardware that my mouse has, since I have a DPI switch for FPS and in general video editing. There is no hardware selection and then my mouse goes no where, 1800 DPI goes crazy and on default sensitivity. DPI switch makes it worse so that is out of the question bad for me.A.I.:A.I. have laser sight vision, take way too much ammunition to kill one single person. If you happen to hear any monkeys, you can bearely see them. They also for some reason CAN'T ATTACK you if you are on a pyramid that you investigate. not smart and bad. If they run away from you and they hit the draw distance, you can see them stuck in a jump and cannot do anything at all. A.I. are not killable if they don't see you, so sniping them is pointelss, unless directly behind them.Audio:Voice acting was terrible, the lines were not well written and the weapon swich has the worst audio quality. Gun sounds are awful and muddy. Some sounds for me were broken until 2 reboots of the game.Maps:Very big, Almost like someone would have some error in development. You can get stuck in certain parts of the map and cannot get out. Shooting behind a rock is pointless. There is an invisible wall that is there for a reason to♥♥♥♥♥♥all of us off, refer to A.I. with out walls that existU.I.:Not really good, compass is useless. Health is defined by a bar, no number which is difficult for me. Not good in general.Final Verdict:If you like bad writing, muddy graphics, and a barely functional game? This is the game for you... Now for those who don't like it, STAY AWAY.Score: 0.25/10Sentence: Stuck in a rainforest with tribes people (Hell). Stay away, Don't buy, torrent, or pirate this piece of crap. Shocking that Unreal Engine was in this too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Here is my Let's Play playlist for Day One: Garry's Incidenthttps://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB43U5A34lu-YiTtoc_jB6BxXp7DfIWaJThe Verdict:overall, I would say no. I played this game full through and it isn't a bad GAME, just a bad EXPERIENCE. The game is super buggy and glitches. The story line makes no sense. It just was not a good experience, very dissapointing. I would say that, since I paid $2 for this game, that if the game was revamped and remastered, it should be that much. Until this game gets an update it should be free. The crafting system I liked a bit, the interactiveness of it was interesting. It is a decent puzzle game per say, but I would not spend money on it in it's current state. Am i looking forward to Day Two? If they read all the imput people have said about this game and fix it, then I would say yes. Like I said, not a bad game, just needs to be fixed up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												Absolutely the WORST game I've ever played. Unforgivably bad. I tried, I really tried to give this game a fair chance. I read bad reviews months ago, so I had hoped the bugs were fixed. I tried, but the game was so bad I only made it through about the first 5 minutes of the game (though it took about an hour of my time). The voice acting is terrible, for example, if you make a mistake crafting, the character spouts off a goofy "uh oh!" Also, why would anyone want to have an animation, complete with quick-time action events...for crafting. The amount of pop-in I experienced made me feel like I was in a laser light show funhouse, and environments were bland and boring. When I killed my first jaguar, it immediately disappeared, so I couldn't skin it and complete the mission. Worst of all, at one point, when I tried to load a save file, the ground wouldn't load. I'd be treated to 45 seconds of loading screen, followed by 2 seconds of falling into a gray abyss, then cue loading screen. The whole premise is campy and weird. And why are there guns randomly strewn about? Why is the player so slow? Why do the natives' clothes only load half the time? Bottom line: Don't buy this game no matter how cheap it is. It's not worth your time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												I had some really high expectations of this game at first, the graphics are beautiful and the UI is stunningly minimalist and modern. I expected an experience similar to 'The Forest', but with more variety and a story-driven plot.As soon as the game starts, things start to go downhill. From the beginning scenes in the tutorial we are shown an almost offensively problematic portrayal south american natives through a very white colonialist lens and rather than attempting the pretence of mocking and subverting damaging stereotypes (A la Far Cry 3, whose claims of the writers are dubious but visible) we are sincerely subjected to scenes of mystique sacrificial ritual and what I can only assume is supposed to be a portrayal of some kind of "Voodoo"/Black Magic (Y'know given my experience of the game so far I'm actually going to go ahead and say 'Aliens'. I haven't ventured far enough into the game to learn if I'm right and if there's a god or some kind of benevolent demon I can sell my soul to I never will).Being an obviously superior drunk ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, of course you overpower your captors (THROUGH A SERIES OF QUICK TIME EVENTS 0^0 SPOILER ALERT QUICK TIME EVENTS ARE USED FOR ALMOST EVERY ACTION IN THE GAME, IF YOU HAVEN'T READ LITERALLY ANY OTHER REVIEW HERE TO LEARN THIS ALREADY) and escape into the rainforest using your superpower of hardened-drunk-white-guy-who-needs-a-drink (It's almost a little noir. Almost. Imagine Max Payne as a bush pilot, except without the writing and characterisation). The first thing that happens as you enter this apparently undiscovered world? A native steals your flask! You must give chase, the end to which is a stretched skin canvas with vague pictorial instructions drawn on it. The native who stole your flask is willing to trade it back to you if you find her... something? It was forgettable and largely irrelevant. I don't even care any more but I would sure love some of whatever was in that flask, I need to purge my memories of having tried this. I can't even be bothered writing anymore of this review. Oh my god it's awful. It is so bad, the crafting is pointless, the plot is lurid, the voice acting hammy with little to no characterisation to speak of in addition to the game largely just being offensive.I thought at ~$1.00 on sale I would receive a game that was playable, maybe a little fun and the bad reviews were hyperbole, but it is just tortuous and incredibly poor taste. The positives? The visuals really are quite good, like AAA quality, the games artists and visual designers should be applauded; it's such a shame they were wasted on such an incredibly poor title. Seriously, if the technical gameplay faults outlined in the other reviews aren't enough to steer you as far away from this title as possible then let these warnings guide you instead.Maybe next time I black out drunk I'll revisit this for some laughs and be able to pass out thinking that Day One is a metaphor for how every shiny promising thing that happens in life somehow turns to♥♥♥♥♥♥Now I must get back to writing my thesis, I can't even bear to use this for procrastination material.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												Absolutely the WORST game I've ever played. Unforgivably bad. I tried, I really tried to give this game a fair chance. I read bad reviews months ago, so I had hoped the bugs were fixed. I tried, but the game was so bad I only made it through about the first 5 minutes of the game (though it took about an hour of my time). The voice acting is terrible, for example, if you make a mistake crafting, the character spouts off a goofy "uh oh!" Also, why would anyone want to have an animation, complete with quick-time action events...for crafting. The amount of pop-in I experienced made me feel like I was in a laser light show funhouse, and environments were bland and boring. When I killed my first jaguar, it immediately disappeared, so I couldn't skin it and complete the mission. Worst of all, at one point, when I tried to load a save file, the ground wouldn't load. I'd be treated to 45 seconds of loading screen, followed by 2 seconds of falling into a gray abyss, then cue loading screen. The whole premise is campy and weird. And why are there guns randomly strewn about? Why is the player so slow? Why do the natives' clothes only load half the time? Bottom line: Don't buy this game no matter how cheap it is. It's not worth your time.

												Here is my Let's Play playlist for Day One: Garry's Incidenthttps://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB43U5A34lu-YiTtoc_jB6BxXp7DfIWaJThe Verdict:overall, I would say no. I played this game full through and it isn't a bad GAME, just a bad EXPERIENCE. The game is super buggy and glitches. The story line makes no sense. It just was not a good experience, very dissapointing. I would say that, since I paid $2 for this game, that if the game was revamped and remastered, it should be that much. Until this game gets an update it should be free. The crafting system I liked a bit, the interactiveness of it was interesting. It is a decent puzzle game per say, but I would not spend money on it in it's current state. Am i looking forward to Day Two? If they read all the imput people have said about this game and fix it, then I would say yes. Like I said, not a bad game, just needs to be fixed up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Through all of the graphical anomalies, uncomfortable silence, and the poorly written/acted dialogue, this feels like an early release of a free indie game you'd typically find on Indie DB or GameJolt. The atmosphere was completely unimmersive and boring. I felt no interest whatsoever in the story (if there even was a story) or the world. The biggest problem besides the awkward animations, both in cutscenes and gameplay, was the general randomness of the audio. During the first time I loaded the game, most activities in game, whether it be getting hit with projectiles, standard enemy sounds, and even player death, was met with an awkward silence. The second time I loaded the game, several more sounds came through, making me question if I may have missed them the first time. I don't think I did. I couldn't bear to play for very long, so I may have missed a major selling point of the game, but it'll be a while until I reinstall this one.I'm not sure what's worse: the game itself or the fact that it costs $10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Through all of the graphical anomalies, uncomfortable silence, and the poorly written/acted dialogue, this feels like an early release of a free indie game you'd typically find on Indie DB or GameJolt. The atmosphere was completely unimmersive and boring. I felt no interest whatsoever in the story (if there even was a story) or the world. The biggest problem besides the awkward animations, both in cutscenes and gameplay, was the general randomness of the audio. During the first time I loaded the game, most activities in game, whether it be getting hit with projectiles, standard enemy sounds, and even player death, was met with an awkward silence. The second time I loaded the game, several more sounds came through, making me question if I may have missed them the first time. I don't think I did. I couldn't bear to play for very long, so I may have missed a major selling point of the game, but it'll be a while until I reinstall this one.I'm not sure what's worse: the game itself or the fact that it costs $10.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2013
												現状まとめ・グラフィックオプションは当初解像度だけだったけど、アップデートで追加された。（未確認）・クラフトは間違えてもアイテムはなくならないので総当りでおｋ、間違えたら「オッオー」・クラフトするにはQTEが必須例えば包帯を作るにはDとAを順番に押す、失敗すると布がどこかに消える。・その包帯を使うのもQTE、W連打、D、A、Sホールドとこれを使用するたびに繰り返す。・ちなみにパンサーに襲われてもQTE、そのあいだは無敵なので基本パンサーに殺されることはないがQTE中に集まってきた猿にタコ殴りにされて死ぬ。・戦闘も大味中の大味、棒立ちで殴ってくる敵を後退しながら殴るだけ。・銃もあるが拳銃が恐ろしく強い、パンサーなら一撃人間なら2発。・しかし人間は体に鉛でも仕込んであるのかと思うくらい頑丈で食らってものけぞるのみ。血とかは一切でない。・隠密も簡単である程度なら走ってもばれず、体が密着する距離で暗殺が可能になる。・その暗殺にはまさかのQTEがなく、アニメーションも木のなたをそっと押し当てるだけ。・売りにしているサバイバル要素も薄く最初につく村で釣り竿を作り、近くの川でサカナ釣ってそこの水を飲んでれば一生生活することが出来る。・一度作ったものは消耗品でない限り壊れることはない。・その魚釣りはマウスを動かして竿を移動させるとかの要素がなく、しばらく待ってSを連打するだけで釣れる。・物語性も皆無に等しいというか超展開で追いつけない。・主人公はなんか知らんが荷物を運んでいて、飛行機がなんかしらん力によって墜落して、なんかしらんが気づいたら生贄にされていた。・途中イベントがはさまるが、特になんも説明されずただ一枚の絵が表示されるだけ。・タイトル画面の音楽だけすごくいい。・進行不能バグ、死体消失バグ、透明なカベが生成されるバグなどバグだらけ。・一応fixされる予定らしい。・純粋に楽しくない。・Steamストア上でトレーディングカード対応と表示されているがバッジクラフト画面は存在しない、なのでもちろんカードはドロップしない。

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												I do not recommend you play this game if you are one of those people that enjoys human psychology and interpreting the actions behind human behaviour and mankind as a whole, or one of those people that tries to avoid stabbing themself in the face with a spoon repeatedly; when possible. You will be thinking about this game for eternity, you will never quite understand why it was made, who they are working for in reality and their motives for not destroying it at birth. The main reason this game astounds me is because; every single person working for this company and every single person who worked on this game inparticular will forever be branded scammers, rip off merchants, jokers, etc, etc. It is an incredibly broken game that uses no intellect or creativity in any way whatsoever. This is the kind of game you purposely leave off your résumé on purpose and will more than likely haunt you in your sleep. There is absolutely no pride in this game, they did not make it with care or love, they churned it out as quickly as they could, with as little effort as possible. You will complete this game in 3-4 hours, and will get about 40 minutes of actual gameplay, the rest of the time will be spent dying to bugs, crashing, or any other number of technical difficulties, providing you don't pass out from shock whilst playing. Okay so, enough about the creation of the game, lets get into the main reason you shouldn't play this game. Do not buy this if you have any self respect for the gaming industry. What is released here is not okay, and the minute we start throwing money at companies like this for their half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥attempts at a game, is the minute we're doomed! I could completely respect these guys if they threw the game away, released it as a project or something else, or just wanted to 'test what they can do' - but they put a decent price tag on this at first, and it fails in every single way, it is borderline theft. Do what you want in your little studio, release things when you are ready, but do not pretend that this is a game, or a game that is ready. They released this knowing what it was and knowing it would receive such bad publicity, but they didn't care, providing they got a few bucks.For shame. For shame.
